Reviewer: Kara Massaro
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: As a restaurant owner, I am not typically one to leave bad reviews‚Äîbut I absolutely have to address something that happened today. I purchased a $16 cheese and fruit plate that was full of old/bruised fruit. I kindly asked if they could remake the plate because my children have sensory issues and wouldn‚Äôt eat the fruit. When they remade it, they gave us less than HALF the food that was on the original plate. When I asked them where the rest of the cheese was, they said ‚Äúthe cheese assortment is at random, that‚Äôs just how we do it.‚Äù It was insanely busy and I didn‚Äôt want to cause any delays for other families, but I am SO disappointed. They served me slivers of apple peels on the second plate, FOUR crackers, and a small pile of Swiss cheese that my children obviously wouldn‚Äôt eat. I feel like they did this deliberately, as the employees looked annoyed I even brought the plate to their attention. For $16, food should be fresh and stored properly to avoid bruising and spoiling. They would not give me a refund. Though my kids love this place, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be visiting again because of the blatant disrespect. I spend hundreds of dollars here a month, so I expected a little more kindness and care. The first photo is what they initially served me, and the second photo is what the replacement plate had on it.

Always paid rounded number before. I assumed that caused by my "stupid" request. Of course I will go again and pay $15, 20, 30 so on because my son wants to play 5-10 minutes and it is some fun gor him.  Five stars for a good idea and place minus two stars for suspicious pricing and "rude" redirection on the empty counter.

Reviewer: Nicole Murphy
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I booked my daughter's 6th birthday here. Before arrival we stopped at Fred Meyers and grabbed a veggie tray and meat & cheese platter, for a total of about $22. Upon arrival the host told me I couldn't bring the food in. My husband had dropped us off to go grab one more thing. I took the closed packages into the party room until his return.The host went and got two more employees and they proceeded to stare at me thru the window and point at me. When I walked out they rudely reminded me to remove the unopen food and I could purchase snacks through them. My husband hadn't returned, so I couldn't remove the food yet. I checked the menu for snack for our guest and realized I'd be spending over $70 for the same food in smaller portions. I went in the toy structure with my daughter, and there was duct tape everywhere. Completely unmaintained and dust everywhere outside of where the kids were playing.After cake my husband cut his thumb fairly deep while cleaning the knife, it was bleeding through napkins & dripping down his arm. We asked to use a first aid kit & the host brought us a small bandaid. We had to leave with his finger wrapped in bloody napkins. Online the party package was $250, & I paid a $50 deposit. At checkout they charged my card another $250. We only had 8 children attend the party. We use to regularly go enjoy the indoor park during our wet NW weather, but I will never return to this business. I will not be surprised if they shut down soon. 100% do not recommend.

Review: I've been here countless times, and have had multiple birthdays here. Overall, its been a fair experience for what it is. This most recent visit was a disappointment, and will likely be my last.

I explained to them they are feeding tubes, disabled, and won't be doing anything beyond sitting in there stroller likely asleep. With a straight face he still said we had to pay for them regardless. Rules are rules, which is fine, but I'll pass in the future if I can't bring along my disabled kids who would just be sitting there seats.

I will also say - their big slides are INSANELY fast. So fast that I feel like should warning signs posted next to them. My son is a toddler, 2.5 years old, and I always sit behind him when we go down the slide. However last time he started sliding 2 seconds before me so he essentially went down the slide by himself. He started going SO fast that he caught air after one of the little bumps and landed on his back/smacked his head on the slide :( we left after that. So just beware, if you have toddlers I do not recommend them going down the slide alone!!

Reviewer: Rachel Mikkola
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited 4 months ago
Review: My family has been going to this place since it opened. This has always been a fun place until recently.  My 10 yo daughter and seven year old autistic son came to me upset and visibly shaken, when I asked what was wrong they said the worker yelled at them to get off a jumping item, I asked my kids why and they had no idea. So when I went to ask the worker she states my kids were not following the rules and stated she told them the rules. I looked at my kids and knew they had no clue. I then asked the worker to please explain the rules to me with my kids there so I knew the rules as well as my kids. ( most mothers do this so when later when  I can remind them before playing.)  instead she just repeated I already told them, over and over. I asked I want to know the rules so I can explain them to my son again later. She refused to and just argued. We decided to leave and will not be back. We will travel to Vancouver or Olympia for our jump houses. Sad the owners were so friendly and staff up until this last year. Keisha the worker needs to learn patience and grace when dealing with children. After a long talk with my kids they said she never said anything to them about rules only yelled at them to get off. Again thank you Keisha for giving my children a negative experience at one of their favorite places.

Response to owners comment

I asked what the rules were of the bounce house in question. Not at any moment did any of the three workers show me the posted rules or that they are online after being asked multiple times. I did not sign a waiver so I was not aware. As a mother that use to go frequently, I walked with my kids and supervised them. The younger girls that worked there before walked around were constantly cleaning the mats and items. I have never seen any of the current staff do this. Typically the gentleman is seen walking around,  the other two ladies are usually sitting talking or on their phones‚Ä¶the customer service has went down hill. They are the face of your company.

Reviewer: Thomas Harris
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited PlayCafe with my two young children, and I have to say, it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. Owners Matt and Michelle have truly created a haven that perfectly caters to both children and their parents.

From the moment we walked in, it was clear that Matt and Michelle understand the unique needs of young families. The play area is incredibly well-designed, with a variety of safe, engaging activities that kept my kids entertained for hours. Every corner of the space is thoughtfully arranged to spark imagination and encourage active play, from the colorful climbing structures to the creative play stations.

What truly sets PlayCafe apart, though, is how well they accommodate parents. The seating area is comfortable and strategically placed so that you can keep an eye on your little ones while enjoying a well-deserved break. The caf√© offers a great selection of refreshments, from freshly brewed coffee to healthy snacks, making it easy to relax and refuel.

Moreover, the entire facility is impeccably clean and well-maintained, which is a testament to the care and dedication Matt and Michelle put into their business. They are always on hand to greet you with a warm smile and are genuinely invested in ensuring that every family has a positive experience.

In a world where finding a place that both children and parents can enjoy equally is rare, PlayCafe stands out as a true gem. It's clear that Matt and Michelle have poured their hearts into creating a space that understands and meets the needs of families. I highly recommend PlayCafe to anyone looking for an all-around great place for kids to play and parents to relax. We will definitely be returning soon!

Reviewer: Heather
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our kids enjoyed playing here, it is great for older kids but we have major concerns about the safety of Jump For Joy for small children. A few of the things we noted:

As with anywhere and any situation parents should be watching their own children but unfortunately not all parents do. We watched kids go behind the jump castles and saw one of the air pumps in a space that was easily accessible. Jump for Joy does  block off these dangerous areas and does not have staff monitoring in the play area.

The gate that allows entry into the play area is not monitored by staff and is very frequently left wide open. I personally walked over and closed it four times while we were there (Two of these instances the staff were not busy, just simply not paying attention). The gate does not automatically close. This is a huge safety concern for anyone with a toddler.

Jump for Joy markets towards small children the owner states in a recent review response "When first setting up the business, I only wanted to be a facility for the smaller kids to get their energy out". This along with other reviews mantioning the lack of attention to the entry and how easy it would be to take a child from here were concerning but we decided to give the place a chance.

I am disappointed that the reviews were accurate and I have to add to the negitive reviews. This place has so much potential, they just need to reevaluate their safety protocols.

How can you market to small children but have so little concern for their safety?

Review: I have taken my kids here twice, and I think it is a great spot for keeping the kids busy and being able to keep an eye on them. In other trampoline parks, I was constantly changing my "spot" following one kid around and trying to get the other to do the same. At Jump for Joy, I can sit on a comfy couch (or massage chair!) and keep an eye on both my kids. You can see most of the play area from the couches.

The kids love the indoor playground, and my older child is into the bounce houses. They have a lot and bouncy slides, too. Even though it doesn't have trampolines, he says he likes it as much as the trampoline parks, if not more.

There are toys for younger kids, too. Toddler cars and toddler play area. They even have a little baby play spot and jumperoo next to the couches. They really thought of how families would use the space.

Review: We live in Milwaukie and discovered this place when our babysitter brought our toddler here on a day out a couple weeks ago, and it was the perfect spot to meet up yesterday with a friend who lives on that side of the river.

Everyone on staff is really friendly and engaged with the parents and toddlers. We had an especially great experience with Jas/Jazz (not sure how to spell her name, sorry!) who is truly excellent at her job. They are constantly walking around and reorganizing and cleaning up toys so all the stations are ready for play.

The play space is incredible! Every station is spotlessly clean, beautiful and perfectly themed with miniature versions of a cafe, home, firehouse, vet, market, farmyard, and gas station! There‚Äôs a school bus the kiddos can climb in, a play structure with a fast and fun slide, sensory stations and activity tables. The kiddos in our group especially loved the fan system that makes the play silks fly and the market where they got to fill carts with miniature grocery items and check them out at the register.

There‚Äôs no outside food allowed to accommodate for allergies but they do have snacks available for purchase, though I didn‚Äôt check prices. Admission is really reasonable for an hour and a half playtime. The bathroom is wonderfully family friendly with a toddler toilet seat, toddler seat with straps, and footstool at the sink, and it‚Äôs even stocked with diapers, wipes, and feminine supplies that you‚Äôre welcome to use which I thought was a really nice touch.

My one and only criticism is very minor - that the employee room/stock room have a door or baby gate in place of the current curtain. My toddler ran in there a few times and I had to chase him out. Beyond that it was an absolutely perfect experience and we‚Äôve already decided with our friend that we‚Äôll be bringing our kiddos every couple of weeks to enjoy the space.

Review: Update:

This place continues to be brilliant. I love it. Worth the drive everytime. My kid literally squeals when he walks in. It's my favorite of all of the indoor kids play spaces!

This might be my favorite indoor kids play space in the Greater Beaverton Area!
(We have tried Leka and Play Street Museum)

What we love:
‚Ä¢ the ability to see your kid from the couches/cafe area; no losing sight of your kid in different rooms
‚Ä¢ the cafe! We loved the idea of freshly made warm drinks! There are pastries, kids snacks, bottled drinks and more for purchase!
‚Ä¢ the playground structure is AMAZING! The configuration is great for toddlers and bigger kids. The huge slide is impressive and still accessible for littles.
‚Ä¢ the individual play spaces are unique and fun! We loved the vintage diner and the grocery store vignettes (our kid LOVED the scanner for the grocery store!)
‚Ä¢ it wasn't over crowded and really seemed to include parents in the thoughtfulness of the layout and space.
‚Ä¢the price! We appreciate it was cheaper than some of the other similarities places and driving to North Plains was barely farther than we go for other places.

‚Ä¢Unlimited play: we loved that we could stay as long as we wanted to :)
Staff were friendly and place was clean and pleasant!

Reviewer: Sonia Leon Pelayo
Rating: 2/5

Review: Hi Elizabeth,

I understand that you mentioned a whole roll of toilet paper being in the toilet, and I wasn‚Äôt able to reply or edit my message. However, I didn‚Äôt want to focus solely on that because it seems to be a recurring issue. The employee herself mentioned that this happens frequently. Given that the facility has a lot of children, it‚Äôs likely that toilet paper gets flushed multiple times throughout the day. In this case, it was an easy fix with a plunger, yet she spent over 50 minutes trying to resolve something that could have been handled in about five minutes.

I want to be clear that I‚Äôm not trying to be rude or disrespectful, but this situation requires some accountability instead of just placing the blame on the client for a clogged toilet. Additionally, the middle sink was also clogged‚Äîif you run it for about 5-6 minutes, you‚Äôll see that it doesn‚Äôt drain immediately. This isn‚Äôt just a toilet issue; it‚Äôs a plumbing issue that needs to be addressed. Maybe it hasn‚Äôt been noticeable in the past because it wasn‚Äôt used as frequently, but we washed our hands multiple times, as did the children.

Regarding the vacuuming, while I understand that keeping the space clean is important, many guests (including us) found it disruptive. In our culture, it‚Äôs considered disrespectful to vacuum or sweep before an event is over. I could understand if there was visible mess, but there wasn‚Äôt‚Äîyet she still took out the vacuum. When I mentioned it to her, she said she was vacuuming the entrance, but there was clearly nothing there. It seemed like she may have been irritated, possibly from a long shift, which I completely understand. However, vacuuming in between people‚Äôs legs and under tables while they‚Äôre talking is highly inappropriate and disruptive.

I just wanted to share this feedback for awareness, and I appreciate your time in addressing these concerns. Thanks

Instead, they waited until it was too late to change plans. Paying $150 just because four kids were celebrating together? They ended up charging us $50 extra but this still leave a bad taste in your mouth.

In addition to the $50, we were rushed to leave and told we had only 15 minutes to clean up when we were supposed to have 30 with the staff going to guests personally to ask them to leave prior to the end of the booked 2 hours. Despite this, the staff received a generous 20% tip ($40) on the remaining balance at the end of the party so I‚Äôm not sure why the owner is claiming she was ‚Äúmistreated‚Äù.

It really is a shame that this business chose to be like this toward families who have been frequent patrons.

Reviewer: Victoria Baker
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Weekday open play review:
I was so excited to try a new kids play place and support a small business, sadly this is not the place to go and I will never be back. Any one of these things wouldn‚Äôt have been a deal breaker but when you piece it all together it‚Äôs a hard no. I‚Äôm sure this place would be perfect for parties!

We picked this place since they didn‚Äôt have a time limit, we checked the night before but then after we all paid they told us there was a 2 hour limit due to a planned school closure. They should‚Äôve put that on the website ahead of time.

I loved the idea in theory of having adult seating and a cafe, they encourage parents to work remote or chat while kids play- the downside is most parents aren‚Äôt watching their kids and no staff are supervising. Bigger kids hit our toddlers and pushed them out of the way and the parents did nothing, but then got upset when we told their kids to not hit. You can‚Äôt have it both ways.

One long play session also seemed like a great idea, but it meant 45 minutes after opening all the toys were moved around and nothing was in the proper area so there really wasn‚Äôt much for the kids to play with- one kid filled up a cart with all the toys and prevented other kids from playing with them (see above parents not paying attention‚Ä¶). The staff tried to pick a few things up 2 hours after opening for a couple minutes but it didn‚Äôt make a difference. On top of that, a good portion of the trains were broken.

Food- we gave our toddlers a snack (allergen-free), and then were told we can‚Äôt have outside food. No problem, but when they asked if it was our first time visiting when we paid it would‚Äôve been helpful to tell us the rules. Later we saw a small sign in the corner that wasn‚Äôt very visible. However, I looked around and every single table around us had outside food including lunch boxes, snacks in ziploc bags. Things obviously not sold there. We were the only table they told not to have snacks. Several parents had outside drinks that weren‚Äôt water. They said it‚Äôs for allergens but the kicker is we have a toddler in our friend group who was there with allergies (SEVERE anaphylactic reactions)- none of the foods available except for one or two things would‚Äôve been safe for him. Other kids were bringing foods that he was allergic to into the play area. The place isn‚Äôt even top allergen free or anything- it‚Äôs just peanuts/tree nuts which most parents can comfortably accommodate by not taking it out like every other kid focused establishment. Enforce a policy uniformly or don‚Äôt have it at all. They said we could leave to have a snack and come back but it was cold/snowing- we chose an indoor play place for a reason. Admission also isn‚Äôt cheap and they expect you to buy their food on top of that if you want to eat inside.

Great idea, poor execution. Far enough out of town that we won‚Äôt be back and we‚Äôll stick to our other usual play options.

Reviewer: Anna Harrison
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 9 months ago
Review: I‚Äôve taken my younger kids for the last two weekends. Today I had an eye on my baby when I was approached by an employee and a mom, and told by the employee ‚Äúyour kid just hit two kids.‚Äù My 3yo was out of eyesight, and I hadn't noticed what he was doing for a couple minutes. But this was so off putting and hurtful. In my 15 years of taking kids to playplaces (I have a teen also), I‚Äôve never been approached like that before. I want my child to keep his hands to himself. I will 100% correct his behavior. But to call me out in such a public way and with another mom hurt so badly. If they weren‚Äôt having fun, I would have left. My review is based on this - the space is very nice. My husband works weekends and there‚Äôs only one of me. Next time, maybe ask quietly not to shame someone. Also, it seems a lot of people are maybe all friends as there was hugs with the employees. My toddler was hit twice after with kids on the push cars. I didn't say anything because of how embarrassed I was while there. Who do I tell? Are you friends with them? I ask that you not forget to treat everyone equally.  I didn‚Äôt want to leave an emotional review but I do want to feel welcomed at places we patronize.

Follow up - not sure why it shows I only recently reviewed this place, as I did so almost immediately after it happened. Months ago. We haven‚Äôt been back since. I‚Äôm stating that I was shamed publicly and you‚Äôre making it sound like my 30lb toddler was on a rampage. The ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry you feel‚Äù is just an added layer here. No accountability for how I was approached. Mom didn‚Äôt seem super emotional, she was just with you. Very evident my family isn‚Äôt wanted here as we are a disturbance to all the friend groups. I should also add that my children were the only black children here. And it was at capacity. Maybe that escalated the concern? Anyway, floored by this response so we will stick with other play places.

We had a terrible experience at We Play on a rainy day with our 20-month-old. To start, the pricing is ridiculous. In the toddler section, my son tried to interact with another child while playing with a toy ice cream stand, only to be pushed repeatedly by the other child. This happened three times before the other parent finally intervened‚Äîafter we called out for them. Most parents were sitting on the sidelines glued to their phones, oblivious to their kids‚Äô behavior.

The worst part was in the ‚Äú4 and under‚Äù section, where older kids were spinning dangerously fast on a toy, hanging off the sides and running recklessly around it. My son was simply walking nearby when they knocked him over. There was no staff monitoring this area, no one enforcing age limits, and no one available to address safety concerns.

This place is a disaster. If you‚Äôre looking for a safe, structured, and enjoyable environment for your child, do not come here. It‚Äôs overpriced, poorly managed, and unsafe. We will not be returning.

Reviewer: Angelina Dmitruk
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: If I could give 0 stars, I would. This indoor playground is absolutely disgusting. I do not recommend bringing your kids here. Don‚Äôt know why I decided to come here twice but I will never be back. We lasted about 20 minutes before I was repulsed and had to go scrub mine and my child‚Äôs hands and leave. It is filthy, sticky, and reeks of dirty equipment. There are crumbs all over the floor, and the cubbies are sticky and stained. And there were stray socks laying around in the playground. There are areas inside the playground that can‚Äôt be accessed by adults (I had to fully lay down at one point (and yes I considered throwing my clothes away)) so clearly no evidence of the place being cleaned. There is no limit to how many people can enter and it was packed to the brim both times. There is no AC, and no air flow. It was extremely hot and the air was thick. Entrance fee is $16 and I don‚Äôt know for what because clearly nothing is being cleaned or maintained. If you do come here I recommend staying in socks the entire time and bringing a change of socks/clothes for your kids. And a bucket of hand sanitizer.

Review: Funtastic Playtorium is nothing short of an exceptional haven for children and families alike. This meticulously maintained indoor playground offers a delightful blend of fun and functionality, making it an unparalleled choice for both recreation and productivity. The vibrant play structures, thoughtfully designed to engage. One of the standout features of this establishment is its exemplary party-hosting services. Whether it‚Äôs a birthday celebration or a special gathering, Funtastic Playtorium ensures a seamless and stress-free experience, complete with well-organized setups, accommodating staff, and an atmosphere brimming with cheer. Parents can rest assured that every detail is taken care of, allowing them to enjoy the occasion alongside their little ones.

For professionals juggling work and family life, Funtastic Playtorium offers a unique advantage. The dedicated seating areas for parents, complete with reliable mall Wi-Fi, create an ideal environment for tackling office tasks while children immerse themselves in play. It‚Äôs a rare blend of productivity and leisure that truly sets this venue apart as one get thier office work done.

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: I P
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. You‚Äôll leave happier than a kitten with a ball of yarn.

Reviewer: Abigail Buckley
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Overall we had a positive experience letting our kids play at Junebug, but a few things I noticed that seemed different than what I expected. Other than a giant ballpit, there were no other play structures or spaces that seemed to be designed for more active play. There were so many wonderful spaces for imaginative and creative play, which my daughter loved. But I know my son was looking for more opportunities to get his energy out.
They have a small more baby friendly corner, but it is not closed off from the rest of the play space. And the rest of the space has several non-baby friendly toys that present choking hazards.
The creative play spaces are all closed off in mini cubicles. So if you have multiple children, it is impossible to keep eyes on all of them at once, making the small toys an extra choking concern.
If you have older toddlers or young kiddos, this space would be great for you! (The kiddo potty and sink in the restroom were a big hit with our toddlers!)
But I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for mamas with babies or younger toddlers who still put small items in their mouths. And it‚Äôs not ideal when looking for a place to let your kids run and play to get their energy out.

Review: My daughter is 3 now, we have been bringing her to WW since she was about 9 months old. It is still her #1 place to ask to go. I like that it is simple, closed in space, and has play structures that provide different levels of challenges (i.e. my daughter worked up to going down the baby slide, and then eventually graduated to the big slide.) Your experience here will depend heavily on 1. Time of day and 2. Which staff are working 3. How busy it is.  If you want to book a party I'd recommend an after hours one so your party goers are the only ones there unless it is going to be a small party.
I have to agree with the other reviews that say that it is kind of getting to that point where they are going to need to temporarily shut down and revamp. At first glance it looks pretty clean but like the other say if you look closely, the tape is wearing off and foam tiles are coming apart, etc. But gotta say of all the play places, it is the lowest stimulus and I feel safe letting my 3 year old run about without having to be right on top of her.

Review: My son absolutely loves Ahoy Kitsap Playland, and it's become one of our favorite go-to spots in Kitsap! We visit often, and every time, he has a blast ‚Äî especially with the slides. The whole place is incredibly kid-friendly and safe, which gives me peace of mind as a parent.
The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming. It's clear the staff cares about maintaining a fun and safe environment. One of the best things is that parents can actually sit back and relax while the kids play. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, good visibility of the play areas, and free Wi-Fi ‚Äî a rare and much-appreciated combination for any indoor play space.
Ahoy Kitsap Playland strikes a great balance between active fun for kids and a laid-back vibe for parents. I highly recommend it to any families looking for a safe, fun, and clean place to let their little ones burn off some energy!

They also have hot and cold food options, a coffee menu, milk shakes, ice cream, drinks for kids and adults, etc. I have nothing had to say about this place. Review: This place was okay, took my daughter and my nieces, a play day for my daughter's birthday. I liked that it was not busy.

So I decided I'll sign the waiver form until someone greets us. But nope, no one said anything. I eventually stood there for a bit until they were kind of done talking. I would have left, but I know my daughter really wanted to play. The lady who helped is kept going on about how she was not supposed to be working today, but came in anyways. "Thank you for being here." I said to her. She then continued to go on about how long her nails were and how it kind of got in her way while she worked. I guess, I just let her talk. Eventually I had to use the restrooms, and it looked like those rest stop restrooms. Both were dirty, with toilet paper on the ground. Dirty toilet, needed to be cleaned. I saw the employee go to the back a few times, I guess she never made it to the bathroom, or didn't want to be bothered by the bathroom.
It was an okay experience. If these things were corrected I'm sure it would be a great place.

Reviewer: Rachel
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Recently had my daughters 6th birthday here. The facility was extremely hot and one of my partygoers ended up with an extreme heat rash and had to leave early. Every child was extremely red and overheated. The staff was rude and did not check on our party at all, outside of dropping off the food that we had to wait forever for. One staff member brought fries on accident, then came back and took them from the kids even though she informed us they were now going to be thrown away. I asked to leave them since they were getting tossed, and she said ‚Äúsorry, I can‚Äôt, my boss is here‚Äù and left. Nobody brought us plates or a cake knife. We had to track somebody down each time and the cake knife was filthy.

Booking the party was a nightmare. Online says Fancy is on sale at 299. Online booking wouldn‚Äôt show the sale price so I called instead. First staff member told me it was not the Fancy party that was discounted but then apologized after viewing the website and realized they were wrong. They transferred me to a manager to book since the front was busy but the manager was short with me and rudely told me the sale price was ‚Äúsold out‚Äù. She did not ask me any questions about the potential party. I booked online anyways and then inquired about it again at check out after the party. The staff member checking us out told me the sale price was available any day besides Saturday. Had I known that, I would have booked the party for a Sunday to get the almost $100 dollar discount. Why did the manager not explain this to me during that initial phone call? Why tell me it was sold out? Why not ask me which day I planned to have the party? The manager, Griselda, was unapproachable and rude over the phone during that initial phone call as well as during the party.

The owner was there and finally came out to talk to me. However, they lied and told me she wasn‚Äôt the owner and that the owner lives out of state. A quick internet search showed me she was the owner‚Ä¶it was very odd that they didn‚Äôt tell me the truth? She clearly did not care to rectify anything. She didn‚Äôt speak English so a staff member spoke to her for me about the situation. All she offered me was 40 dollars (gift card) for my next visit even though I paid close to 600 after everything. I wish I realized who she was while I was there still. Although it‚Äôs such a weird situation to pretend you‚Äôre not the owner!

The lack of professionalism, the terrible customer service, the lying, the heat that no one was willing to fix, the lack of accountability‚Ä¶the whole experience was so unforgivable. I‚Äôm so disappointed.

EDIT to respond to reply:
You guys had one other party going on while we were there. Every single person in there that day knew how hot it was. We heard numerous people complain outside our party and could visibly see most of the patrons sweating.
As for the booking, I called because I wasn‚Äôt going to sit and enter in different dates. I should be able to call and expect honesty, information, and great customer service. Your employees gave me three separate and conflicting responses and Griselda was terribly rude. You reviewing your software system means nothing and is not related to the situation. I was able to book, the discount wasn‚Äôt applying. I should have been told why and not that it ‚Äúsold out‚Äù which wasn‚Äôt true.

I left that day defeated. Only reason I was somewhat calm and nice upon leaving, was because Jessie, your front desk employee, was great at handling things. As far as I knew, he‚Äôd done all he could do (this was before I knew he was also lying to me about who you were). I knew that outside of that, I was not going to get any more help and decided to email the owner. Although you were there the whole time but did not convey your true identity as owner and did not speak English. What else was I to do? The manager left. You are dishonest and I‚Äôm so disgusted at how you chose to handle this whole situation.

Why respond to this review but not my email? Your response here is misleading and isn‚Äôt even close to addressing everything.

I want my money back.

Reviewer: Sunny
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We arrived around 5 PM, so it wasn't too crowded, which was perfect. The facility felt clean and secure‚Äîyou're buzzed in from the reception area after staff check that everyone has removed their shoes. My kids range from 1 to 10 years old, and there was something for all of them. Different play zones for different age groups, plus an arcade, kept them busy the entire time. They played non-stop for the full 2.5 hours we were there.

It's a flat-rate entry for the whole day‚Äîno hourly fees‚Äîso we didn't feel rushed, which was great considering we drove over an hour to get there. The on-site cafe also had a solid selection of food items, with plenty of kid-friendly options (a big win if you've got picky eaters like I do).

The only downside was seeing older kids roughhousing in the toddler area. It made things a bit stressful with my younger ones (1 and 4), since I had to stay close to make sure they didn't get hurt. To be clear, this is NOT on the employees‚Äîthey were doing their jobs. This is more about parents needing to be aware and present. It's not a drop-off zone, and playing on your phones shouldn't take priority over supervising your kids. OWN UP.

That said, I'm still giving this place five stars. It's clean, well-organized, and thoughtfully designed for families with kids of all ages. We'll definitely be coming back.

Reviewer: Gina
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My 8mo old daughter is very mobile but not quite walking. I was looking for a place for her to climb on some safe padded things and maybe a tunnel to crawl through, nothing much. I found this place and the website states 0-8months can play for free. I thought how great that would be since she isn't big enough to walk or use some of the other stuff. The online booking form didn't work and kept saying I am not authorized, even after registering, so I decided to drive there and check it out. I was met by two girls at the front desk who were super rude and seemed to have no clue how to have a normal interaction with a customer. They proceeded to tell me it's only free if they are accompanying a sibling. That is not what the website states. They also looked at her and said, "shes pretty small", as if I am a total idiot for thinking she could play there.  Regardless, they said it would be $9 for my daughter. I wasn't sure if I wanted to pay that since she wouldn't be able to use all the toys. They said I could take my shoes off and check it out if I wanted. I agreed and took my shoes off. I then stood at the gate, waiting to be let in, while both girls stood at the desk doing nothing, for what felt like an eternity. In my mind I was thinking, hello, is anyone home, you just said we could come in and check it out. Finally after making awkward eye contact, they slowly moved toward the gate and let us in. The toys for little ones were super dirty and in that same area there was an adult, lying face down on a bench (sleeping, napping? I don't know). I walked around the other areas which seem cleaner than the toy area but honestly, not worth $9 for my daughter. Based on the lack of basic human communication from the girls who worked there, combined with the misinformation on the website and dirty toys, I won't be returning, even when my daughter is bigger.

Reviewer: Armina Fedorov
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Never in my life have I been spoken to in such a horrible, nasty manner as the manager spoke to me. It was unsolicited and unnecessary to speak to me in such a nasty tone and voice, like i'm a child being yelled at.. I had a misunderstanding because I was told I could come in 30 minutes early to decorate. But by early, they literally meant to come at my booked time. THAT WAS HIGHLY UNNECESSARY to say to a client. If they never said that, i would assume my time strictly starts at 6, and i can do as i please with it. When I saw it written in the policy that said, "Decorations may be delivered
within 30 minutes of the party time." Again, I understood this as 30 minutes before my set time i can decorate. How much more unclear can you be? I understood it as earlier than the set time since I was told that in person, I had made out the invites already at 6 pm because of this. So that leaves me no time to decorate. I didn't want to push the party back because little kids are tired by 8 pm..and I didn't want a super short party if I told guests to come at 6:30. When I told them my problem, the manager took all day till almost closing to get back to me. An employee who was super nice was helping me to reschedule most of that time.. but she needed approval from the owner.  So while i waited for an answer, i went ahead and let my guests know i am rescheduling so i dont tell them last minute. When the owner contacted me, I was expecting to hear from the owner a yes or no for the coming Friday, but instead she spoke to me in an attacking manner that i can not reschedul the day before, i would basically be canceling, loosing my $200 deposit and scheduling a new day but that all weekends were booked for 3 months (so good luck!) She said to me that rescheduling has to be done 7 days prior, but I had booked the appointment 7 days prior so that leaves me zero chance to reschedul. On top of that, I did not want to have to reschedule, but because they told me I could come in early to decorate, I was counting on that. Then she told me she will not make an exception for Fridays because it's one of their highest paying days. (So my $200 deposit i'd be forfitting plus $500 for 2.5 hours wasn't enough for her). Then she told me I could come in 15 minutes early on my set time with an extra charge to do so. Because this is their policy. She was money pinching BAD! Basically, she was not willing to work anything out. And incredibly rude while at it! I couldn't stop myself from breaking down into tears because my babies birthday was super important to me. So when she realized I was holding back tears; she offered me to come in 10 minutes early. When I said I didn't want to pay more, she said if it's 15 minutes, she will charge me extra, but for 10, she won't! Money pinching makes me sick. I called my husband crying, and he said to just cancel even if we lost the $200 deposit. He didn't want to give her more money after how she spoke to me. He also remembered clearly her telling me that i could come in early to decorate when she was pitching me the party idea. Regardless of my mistake, they made mistakes, too. It was not okay to speak to me in the manner she spoke to me! I felt so mistreated!

I hate to compare but once again, the other local spot we like to play at, has staff on the floor at all times, cleaning constantly. Lastly, when you book for a birthday party, it‚Äôs a ‚Äú2hour play time‚Äù however, decorating is only within that time frame so they ask you to tell your guests to come in 30 min later. Why would anyone pay that much money for 1.5 hours of  birthday party play time? Needless to say, I decorated as my guests walked in haha. Oh well. I wanted to make use of the time I paid for. I appreciated the help the younger girl who was working there offered me. I had to walk up there myself to ask since no one ever came to ask if we needed  anything but the young gal was super friendly and ready to help me when I did ask. I have seen other reviewers say that the staff helped clean up after their party but I was offered no help. I‚Äôm not sure if we are supposed to ask but I thought that was weird so I cleaned up myself. Overall though, we had fun.

Reviewer: Anna Harrison
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I need to start by saying that my kids love Chicky Play. So much so, that we drive nearly an hour to get there. I‚Äôd been happy up until our last experience last week. The good - I really do think it‚Äôs a lovely play space. I‚Äôm happy to spend the money on playtime and treats. If it brings my kids joy, it brings me joy. The bad - last weeks visit was so so bad. My husband and I finally had time to take them together and the kids asked to go. I checked capacity around 9:30 and it said zero people were playing. So we get our shoes on and head out the door. It takes us roughly an hour to get there and we were told they were at capacity, 55 people. My kids are melting down and screaming trying to get inside. Never did I imagine we would drive so far to be turned away. Or that I needed to keep checking their website. The gal at the counter was frustrated with my frustration and meanwhile, other parents are telling us to head to a local play place instead. But I‚Äôd intended on taking a work meeting while my husband played with the kids. So he drags them out crying and I go next door. Not before we both put ourselves on the waitlist. And they said they expect to see people leave within 20 minutes. Oh, I also counted and there was maybe 30 people inside. There was definitely not 55. Anyway, we decide we will try to wait because they want to play so badly. I go next door to take my meeting and he sits in the car with them. No update online for 30 minutes online. Then it switches to 47 people playing but still at capacity???? Then he calls and is told he may as well not come in now that they have space and there‚Äôs only 20 minutes left to play. We took the kids to eat and decided (begrudgingly) to take them back to the 1pm session. The gal at the counter acted as if she‚Äôd solved this problem for us. It was incredibly frustrating. We let the kids play during their nap time and pulled them out after an hour. We skipped our usual treat purchase and went home. I don‚Äôt see myself making this drive again unless we have zero other options. And I‚Äôm bummed because they do love it there. I just won‚Äôt risk a meltdown of saying we are going somewhere and being turned away. Open reservations back up and people won‚Äôt have this issue.

Reviewer: Nick L

Review: I would like to inquire about the rules of your indoor playground. I brought my two children to play, and they were having a wonderful time, making friends with all the other children.

While playing and running around, one of my children coughed a couple of times, which is completely understandable as children may cough lightly due to physical exertion. However, I felt deeply offended when two other parents‚Äîwho, in my opinion, were dressed quite inappropriately for a children‚Äôs indoor playground (revealing clothing that I didn‚Äôt find suitable but chose not to comment on, as I prefer avoiding unnecessary conflict)‚Äîreported my child‚Äôs minor cough to your staff.

I explained to your staff that my children are not sick; the cough was simply a natural result of running and playing, and nothing more. Despite this, your staff repeatedly came over to wipe down every toy my children touched, seemingly pressured by these two individuals. This created an uncomfortable and stressful atmosphere for us, as it felt like we were being unfairly singled out.

As a result, we chose to leave after only half an hour, cutting short what should have been an enjoyable visit for my children.

This kind of treatment is simply not appropriate. It left us feeling unwelcome and unfairly judged. I would appreciate a response regarding your policies and how you handle such situations in the future.

Rating: 5/5

Review: Slightly tempted to gate keep this place. üòÇ

We had the party room on May 3rd. It was our first time here. Things I loved:

1) Wow, it's stunning inside.

2) It's CLEAN, whoa what! üòú

3) It's not employed by a bunch of teenagers, it's actual adults and they're helpful and professional.

4) Rules are actually enforced. Socks are required and they do have someone standing at entry to check for this. Super greatful for this as people tried to sneak in without it.

Things I didn't love:

1) It was advertised we'd have admission for the entire day, this was not true for us. If they sell the venue they will kick you out.

This happened to us. We were given a credit of 100 twinkle coins as compensation but it pales in comparison to what I expected and under minded what I put on the invitations.

2) I had a strong head count for who was at our party but I some how exceeded it, which I fear I was charged for people NOT belonging to my party.

There was an unofficial party being hosted there in the corner. I hadn't disputed it because I was overwhelmed keeping things in order and had only figured it out afterwards.

Overall, it's a great place and I would recommend it.

Reviewer: Wendy Lee
Rating: 3/5

Review: My family was visiting Seattle and I thought it would be nice to check out this place. In my honest opinion $32 for all day unlimited play is expensive. I‚Äôve been to other play places before and they are not nearly as expensive as this one. The play area only had 2 slides and not many obstacles inside the climbing gym. It‚Äôs also super dusty by the back windows and there‚Äôs a few areas that should be fixed, ie; the big cone slide, seam around the seated part at the top is ripped exposing the wood which could hurt someone. One of the boards to support the upper part of the climbing gym feels a little loose and uneven, like it could give way. Also an additional $23 to do a ‚Äúdiy‚Äù activity is overrated. You get to play with a little water table and kinetic sand then take home one item of 3 choices (dig up a surprise, water beads in a jar or a mini brick house). On top of that, they advertise and say there‚Äôs food and what not but I couldn‚Äôt even get a Vietnamese ice coffee bc the ‚Äúbarista‚Äù was not in. All that was available was canned beverages and ice cream. I got a push pop for my son that was $4 which was only a regular size one but labeled as ‚Äújumbo‚Äù. I understand people gotta make money too but come on, this is a place for kids to have fun not rip parents off. Lastly, the arcade games are expensive and the card system is rigged. Got a $20 prepaid card, played 2 games (most don‚Äôt even tell you how much it is) that were probably $5 each and ended up with $7 left. How does that make sense? I ended up giving our card to another parent since we weren‚Äôt going to come back. But overall, not too bad of a place, just be ready to spend a lot of money!

Reviewer: Andie LaMantia
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our experience was a bit lackluster. First, their online ordering platform from the website was incorrectly set up, so there were weird add-on options (such blue cheese as an option for adding into lemonade and itallian sodas, rootbeer as an add on to the coffee drinks, and then food/drink just in the wrong locations (if you clicked food, there were random drinks mixed in etc).

Once we got there the staff was very friendly, and respectful to my kiddo,  but the first order of drinks we got was incorrect (unfortunately I am allergic to coffee, and the big gulp of "not chai" didn't do great things for me) and they forgot our desert completely. (Thankfully I had asked for a receipt and was able to point out the mistake before we left.

The play area was fine for little kids- like 4 to 6 os probably the ideal age. Ther website said that it was a good spot for up to age 12- and given the "interactive dance area" (supposed to have wii like interactive lighting) and the "ball shooting cannons" we thought it might be OK for our 9 year old- however the "dance area" was broken-  no interaction to the found, and some of the ball cannons were also broken. She was the oldest by far- spent some time Palling around with some 7 year  Olds but was ready to leave after about an hour.

The food was ok. The pizza was thick crust and a tad gooey (which Is my preference so I appreciated that). The cheese and fruit platter was meh. It had a few very very sour blueberries, a handful of very tasty grapes, a few pieces of decent honeydew mellon, thw cheap butterfly shaped crackers , and some chunks of orange cheddar ( and presumably white chedder?)

Seating was plentiful, though there were only 3 spots with cushioned chairs- we ended up sitting right next to the play structure in order to sit in one of the comfy cushioned chairs, but then had to listen to the chorus of screaming kids (I know that's what kids do.. it was just not ideal for our family with an infant trying to sleep. )

Parking was difficult to come by.

It was pretty overpriced for the experience we had, though maybe I would feel different if we had a 5 year old instead of a 9 year old.

Reviewer: Mike Norton
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I just saw a previous review saying it is for kids 5 and older. That is not true, I have been taking my son Keanu here since he was 2. They have a toddler section but not only that, they can learn to climb and develop motorskills and physical coordination at that age by allowing them to struggle a little bit. But here is the caveat, this is only doable when it is not busy. If it is too busy, you should crawl with you toddler and accompany them closely so they don‚Äôt get trampled. And if there are a lot of kids on the trampoline, don‚Äôt bother with a child under three, the other kids will bounce them around and they won‚Äôt be able to stand up.

There are bathrooms, a party room for birthdays in the back. Ball cannons, two slides one open one enclosed. There is no ball pit. The toddler section is only for 3 and under and has some developmental toys.

Warning: there are spinning carousel tea cup things that the kids can sit in and spin around. They can be dangerous if they are spinning fast and your child tries to climb out while it‚Äôs still moving. If children are using them, there should be an adult supervising them for that particular part of the play place.

Here are some videos and pictures from multiple visits. Some are from 8 months ago when my son was just over 2 years old. Some are from 2 months ago.

Review: My 7 year old saw this on Blippi and has begged to go. We went on a very low traffic day (midweek, during the school day) and there were only a few kids there with us, mostly babies, which made sense. My daughter enjoyed it a lot! The woman working there when we got there seemed disinterested (very much in line with the other reviews I've seen) but she was kind to the kids who approached her, and mine when she asked a question. I liked the wristband ID system, though when we left no one was at the door to check us out and the gate wasn't secure, but fortunately I left with the child I arrived with.

The play structure requires a step in on all sides, so even on the base level where the ball guns are, and even to get into the zone with the octopus, kids need to be mobile enough to step over them. I feel that it'd probably be fairly easy to modify it to allow kids in wheelchairs to enjoy too.

My biggest problem with this place is the lack of comfortable seating. My child is old enough to not need vigilant supervision in places like this, so I'd planned to kill two hours here relaxing while my daughter burned energy, but the options are uncomfortable bar seats, uncomfortable foam blocks on the floor, or the best option, uncomfortable foam columns. Honestly, for this reason alone, it's a one and done for us.

Review: As a parent, this was a fun place to take my kiddos and hang out with a mom friend and her kid. It was a little dusty/dirty, but I noticed a few workers actively cleaning, which is essential to do while kids are playing, as they are messy! The rules are as enforced as I was hoping, but I think this is more on the parents than the staff. The rules clearly state to supervise you children. It‚Äôs not a free for all. I noticed many parents hardly paying attention, meanwhile me and couple others desperately trying to see their kids on the top part, which is harder to supervise. Maybe little security cams would help at least for the top portion. I wouldn‚Äôt be able to see them usually unless I took a picture or they came back down. The toddler area was clean and my littles used it a bit when smaller kids weren‚Äôt, as they are 2. It was great for my low muscle toned girl who needed a break from the big toys sometimes. And fun enough for her twin brother to join her there. Why there was a little tv in that area, I‚Äôm not sure, but seemed odd for a toddler area, but I got my kid away from it after a few minutes cuz we came to move! Bathroom is fairly clean, though it would be nice to have a smaller toilet since it is for kids and my kid is potty training.

But it didn‚Äôt feel like the workers wanted to be there very much. I assume typical high schoolers, but I couldn‚Äôt tell if there was a manager also present. Somebody needed to be in charge. I figured it‚Äôs just a job for them, but as an educator I would hope to have a little bit more enthusiasm for working with kids.

reviews:
{Reviewer: pradeep surya
Rating: 1/5
Time: a week ago
Review: Hi,
I had a very disappointing experience at WiggleWorks today. The listed closing time for Saturdays was 9:00 PM, so I arrived with my child at 7:30 PM expecting a full evening of play. However, I was surprised when the lights were turned off at 8:15 PM without any prior notice or communication from the staff.

When I asked about it, I was told the store doesn‚Äôt always follow the posted hours and may close early if the turnout is low. This felt unfair and frustrating‚Äîespecially after paying the full weekend entry fee of $15 for what ended up being barely 45 minutes of playtime.

It would be helpful if early closures were clearly communicated at the entrance or online, so families can plan their visits accordingly. I hope the store can be more transparent and consistent moving forward. Thank you for taking this feedback seriously.

Review: The concept of this place is great. A play place targeting toddlers and 3-4 year olds. I have been to many places with my son who just turned 3. Children‚Äôs museums, funtastic playtorium, trampoline parks, arena sports, pump it up Lynwood, etc‚Ä¶and they all do a great job entertaining 4-12 year olds, but for kids under four it can be dangerous or require close supervision.

So the approach Wiggle Works takes is a needed niche, but the owner has one foot in their business one foot out. They collect the income but don‚Äôt reinvest it into upkeep of the place. These are franchises. And this franchisee needs to sell the location to someone who will fix it up and keep it clean.

Reviewer: Dell L
Rating: 5/5

Review: The premise of this place is simple: pay a reasonable admission fee for all day long (come & go is allowed); big enough of a space to have kids run around, small enough to not be difficult on a parent to watch their kid. The place is not meant to wow the kids (or the parents), it‚Äôs just meant for parents to bring their kids and tire them out (oops, did I say tire them out? J.k. I mean, bring them to provide them with a safe space to work on their gross motor skills).

The place is designed so that a parent can sit on a stool and watch their kids play. Kids can eat food brought from outside, and eat it on the counter tables.

Every time I come I see that the parents are looking at their phones / working on their laptops/ chatting with other parents/ relaxing. There aren‚Äôt many places in which one can do that, so for that, this place gets 5 stars from me!

My only complaints are: 1) it could indeed be kept in better condition; 2) if you want to bring another parent costs extra; 3) some of the teens working here have a poor attitude (one teen in particular gets an annoyed look every time someone approaches, because it means he needs to get up, and stop looking at his phone); 4) WiggleWorks just recently updated their system so that now they show tipping options‚Ä¶seriously? Reviewer: The Johnstons
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Do not go! There are so many better options within 10 mins drive of this place. 11$ for unlimited playtime seems like a great deal, and it would have been if the place was well run and clean. The play area looked great from the outside, however it is very dusty and dirty. Not great for babies who put things in their mouths. The equipment is visibly dirty too. We sent 3 hours there because we were on a playdate and I wasn't going to be rude and leave, I also payed to be there. I did see one staff member gentle wipe a few areas but not hard enough to actually clean anything.  As for the bathrooms hold your pee or leave because it was awful! The floors were sticky and gross. No paper towels in the bathroom or seat covers, the sink was covered in something suspicious as was the door handle to exit the bathroom. The staff tell you as you enter not to go on the rides, no problem however what they don't tell you is they include the climbing structure as a ride, so as I went up with my kids they threw a fit and were incredibly rude.  Will not be back.

Reviewer: Eric Ohlin

Review: Plus 1 star because my kid had fun for the most part.

Negative 4 stars because this place leaves a lot to be desired.
---When is the last time anyone cleaned this place?
---The fans have so much crud built up on them, and they blow directly on the children in the balloon area.
---Bandaids and popped balloons all over the place. Choking Hazard much???
---Trash cans areas are disgusting.
---Bathrooms have no paper towels and a door handle you must touch to open.
---Zero employee smiles. Zero welcoming gestures. Gloomy feeling vibe from the entire staff on June 10, 2023. Was I on the set the walking dead?
---*** ü§Ø You get matching bracelets when you enter for kid/parent identification, but there are zero people actually checking when you leave. When I left with my kid, the employee took the bands and let us leave without checking them. They sure have created an illusion of safety, but it's exactly that... An illusion.  (the person who let me leave, was not the person who checked me in.) **Also, the person that checked me didn't even instruct me to put the band on the child, and said it was perfectly acceptable to just hold them, so the bands were never put on anybody. When I left, it was without confrontation and I left with a child that had no band (my child of course. But no one who works there would have known this.)

This was my first time at this establishment, and overall it was pretty disappointing.

When I‚Äôve been there the staff has been kind, helpful and attentive to their duties of cleaning and supervising the space. There can be a lot of unmasked kids here, so if you‚Äôre super concerned about your child‚Äôs risk of exposure to COVID or other infectious illnesses this probably isn‚Äôt the place for you. I don‚Äôt see the risk here being any greater than at daycare or any other indoor play space. I got a Mediterranean wrap which was good and filling but it was just a small wrap with nothing else and it was eight or nine dollars . Reviewer: Long Light Productions ///
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Hoping a one star review will get the attention of the owners or at least be a warning to others having a party here. The actual party and service were great. The reason for the one star review is their tipping system. When I went to cash out for the day the automatic tips that popped up were a percentage of the entire cost for the party (admission for 15 kids and the room etc). I'm all for tipping fairly but one hour of dropping food service did not warrant a 25% tip for the  cost of the whole thing. I clicked "other" to put in a custom tip and didn't realize it was a percentage vs a dollar amount. I tip on these machines very often and never has it had me enter a "custom percentage" All that to say I ended up getting charged $100 over my intended tip without my knowing it. I would've never realized this but happened to check my bank statement and saw I was way over charged for the party. I called PDX Play date and talked with a very kind manager who eventually said she could do nothing but would forward my complaint to the owners and to expect a call back and they never reached out. PDX Play date I would recommend you adjust your system to leave a custom dollar amount, not a percentage. This is very misleading as there is no final cost screen before your electronic signature. Also I will remove this review if your owners decide to reach out to me to try and reconcile this issue.

Reviewer: Lauren Foltz
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Family friendly | Great events | 2hrs well spent

We are a big fan of this indoor play place. It is so well thought out. We have been here a few times including their Easter egg hunt. I highly recommend this place for young families.

This place is popular and for good reason. They have three big sand pits for kids to dig in for hours. Check their web to see if there is a waitlist. If they‚Äôre full, put your name on the waitlist and time when to head over. However, the person at the front desk said the wait is usually shorter.

The workers are friendly and helpful. There are cubbies to put your items. They also provide protective eyewear if your kid doesn‚Äôt want sand in their eyes. Otherwise, just bring yourselves! They provide all the tools to have fun in the sand. Everyone must be barefoot.

There is a small area in the very front near the entrance for babies to play. There is also a small snack and drink area. You can eat your packed lunch at the tables or feel free to buy some snacks and drinks from a self serve kiosk. They also sell some merchandise and toys. There are two family friendly bathrooms, but one is larger so if you have a stroller and/or a big family, you all can fit in that one. This large bathroom has a small toddler toilet, which is awesome when you‚Äôre potty training a little one. In the cabinet there are some diapers.

The workers periodically sweep the sand back in the pits. They keep the place clean and safe. It‚Äôs a great place!

Their Easter egg hunt was so much fun too. Probably the most fun and safe egg hunt I‚Äôve ever been to because they limited the number of people attending each session. Everyone found tons of eggs everywhere, and three people found the three golden eggs for a prize! They brought out the Easter Bunny (looks like Peter Rabbit) and gave away a goodie bag before leaving. Worth it for $30.
We‚Äôll be back next year for this event.

Reviewer: Sarah Jardin
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: ** Updated ** Must Read**

Bettie, there was no signage placed around the building or parking lot the day of our visit. If this is a recent enhancement, your guests will certainly appreciate the improvement.

Since you brought up the email, allow me to set the record straight. I called LEKA asking for the owner to reach out. After sharing my story with your employee at LEKA, I was met with compassion, understanding, and acknowledgement that what me and my family went through at DigPDX was not appropriate for any customer. Given you‚Äôve changed policy so much, they were very reassuring it could have been handled differently.

The employee took notes on my experience and my phone number and that she would have you call my mobile. Not email. Not by post. I was expecting a phone call. Was leaving my phone number with an employee too complex of a notion to follow through by phone? Was the expectation not clear?

On that same call I let the employee know I would wait one week before reaching out again knowing that an owner might be busy‚Ä¶running a business‚Ä¶ the week in between was me being respectful of your time. More importantly, if I had known you were going to pull my husband‚Äôs email from our customer profile, I might have been monitoring the inbox. Again - effective communication is crucial. Thank you for bringing that up.

***Original Post***

Effective communication is crucial. I recognize the necessity for businesses to adapt their policies in response to factors such as demand, scale, and safety, and I fully respect their decisions.

However, the recent policy changes at DigPDX have occurred three times within the past six months, yet they have not been adequately communicated to customers. Regrettably, our family did not receive notification that Sunday hours now require reservations, resulting in an unexpected inconvenience.

Sadly, as my 4 and 2-year-old children were in tears, and my eldest asked, "why do those babies get to stay and play?" after eagerly entering the building, it was the owner, Bettie, who addressed us over the commotion. She explained the policy change, expressed that the establishment was at capacity, and regretfully informed us that no exceptions could be made.

After the incident, Bettie and I communicated via email. I'm sure she had the best of intentions, but this situation was handled very poorly. Simply posting a sign on the door stating "Reservations only" would have saved us a lot of trouble and time. Implementing policy changes requires proper change management, and I hope this feedback is considered for future adjustments to prevent other families from experiencing the same ordeal.

Reviewer: Eileen Tao
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We've been waiting for DiG to open since we first heard about it, almost a year ago.  And wow, we were not disappointed!  The walls are adorned with beautiful scenery; the sand is luxuriously soft (so soft!); facilities are clean and kid-friendly; and the staff are welcoming and helpful.  Most importantly, the kids had a blast exploring the different themed play spaces, and having access to a variety of sand toys.  Sensory play is so important for the littles, and it was fun to see them really get creative with it (and make some new friends in the process).

Like Leka, you can check the DiG website to see how busy they are at any given time.  There's a 35-kid safety limit, which I appreciate because over-crowded spaces can be stressful for us.  If the limit is reached, you can place yourself on a virtual waitlist.  Our days are typically pretty flexible and we live close-by, so this works out fine for us.  The big bonus here is that there's NO play time limit, and once admitted, we can come and go during the day as needed.  If you require the certainty of a scheduled session, I see on their website that reservations for 1.5 hour play sessions are an option for Sundays.

Someone had mentioned dust being a problem, but we didn't have any issue during our visit.  I thought it was considerate to provide kid-sized goggles by the cubbies at the front.

We cannot wait to return, and play on both rainy and sunny days.  Honestly, the sand here beats the beach!

Reviewer: Charlie Liu
Rating: 1/5

Review: I don't give 1 star reviews often, but I would give this a zero star if I could.

1. Safety - there are very few rules, and all of them were broken every minute. The parents are either not present or are too busy with their electronic devices. Reviewer: Naved Rangwala
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 years ago
Review: We should have checked the reviews on yelp before going to this place. We went here with our daughter and realized its the worst kids play ground in all of Seattle. Specially the lady at the front desk. She is rude as hell.

First of all its a very small place and we went on a weekday. It was completely empty and even then there was not much for daughter to do. I can imagine on weekends when there are more kids, how cramped it can get. For $12, its not worth it at all, even with a groupon for 9 bucks. I would rather spend $20 at Jumping Beans since its a much bigger place and so many things for the kids.

Second and the most important, the lady on the front desk is the worst and that resonates from other reviews as well. When we went there and told her that we have a groupon, she started telling us that we can use groupon only twice a month and how people cheat. Really, is this the thing you tell some one who come there for the first time. Then when my daughter started playing, she started bugging us for small things, that she can't do this and that. The last straw was, when I went in the back to heat up my daughters food, she came screaming at me, that you should ask me before using the microwave. I mean seriously, this is not the first playground I have taken my daughter to. She's that rude specially at a kids place. I would expect people running anything related to kids be calm and polite. And its not that I did something.

She is a troubled lady and needs help.

But any ways we won't be going to that place ever again.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!

Reviewer: Elina Benin
Rating: 1/5
Time: 8 years ago
Review: Today I went to this facility for the second time. I went with my two year old son and my two friends, who both have 1.5 year old babies.
Our kids play together all the time and are all friends.
When we came in, the receptionist was on her personal cell phone and said we can pay after she gets off the phone. We proceeded to enter and our kids to play.

35 minutes into the time we were there, my son (2 years old) was playing and wrestling with his friends. We, the moms were monitoring. Taking photos and laughing.
At one point another girl who we did not know came to play, and my son threw an air balloon at her. Yes, air inflated balloon. I automatically turned to her mom to apologize and went to my son. The mom said no worries.

As I am approaching my son, the same receptionist, "Claudia" yanks his hand and tried to get him off the play area. I was two steps away and mid movement told her to not touch my son. She started yelling that my son is too aggressive and needs to leave. I explained that she needs to approach me and not touch my child. She continued to yell and berate me that my son was causing havoc and that she was calling security on the both of us. Yes, my 2 year old.

The mom of the girl automatically stepped in as did both my friends and the manager said that we all had to leave and called security.

We complied, got ready and left. Met security outside and he apologized for what happened.

Fast forward to 20 minutes later. I realize I left my wallet at this "kid facility". I called and a guy answered. He said they had no wallet. I knew where I left my wallet and returned there. I asked for my wallet and again both Claudia and this gentlemen told me that my wallet was not there. While all this was happening, a woman turns to both Claudia and the guy and says " why are you lying, I just handed you a wallet". Both looked dumbfounded and confused and I threatened to call 911. Seconds later my wallet was returned to me.

Never returning to this place. Also forgot to mention. We told Claudia that there were rocks in the play are and asked to vacuum. She ignored that request.

-----------------------

Review: ****BEWARE!!  NEVER EVER PARTY AT GIGGLE JUNGLE!!!!

First of all a big Thanks to Giggle Jungle, for their ruthless courtesy towards our guests in the event.

*I booked the event here only after they agreed upon for decoration. Here is the below confirmation from you upon registration.  "Minions theme decoration, dark blue/yellow colors, balloons. Wall decoration and happy birthday banner with name" . Shockingly just one day before, that too when I went to them and asked about the arrangements, that time I got to know that no decoration is provided. This made me not to change the event in the last minute.

*Wiggle Works which is in Cross Roads, Bellevue have much better ambiance, space and more fun activities is providing the same service for just $129 on weekdays. When I asked the same question during the booking, the reply I got from their staff is that they are providing the decoration which costs more and hence $199. But this decoration has never happened.

*Before starting of the party they never told us that they have hard stop at 8PM. But they just came to us 10 mins before 8 and forced us leave immediately.

*I asked for yellow and Blue combination of plates and table covers but when the party is about to start you provided us only yellow items. I went out to get the decoration and other table covers which killed almost 30 mins of my time.

*Last but not the least, they said so many policies about your GJ/RTC and forced us to vacate the place by 8:15 but still charged us $50 for the additional time.  After I sent this feedback they returned me $50 back but that is other side of the story.

Reviewer: Angela C
Rating: 2/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: TL;DR: Not for parents who value screen-free, hands-on, creative play and care about noise/visual overstimulation after the 1/16/2025 remodel.

2 stars after the remodel (was 4 stars before).

We used to love this place. On rainy days, my 3-year-old would climb, build with foam blocks, and enjoy pretend play with wooden toys. The slide and toolset were his absolute favorites‚Äîhe could spend hours happily exploring and playing. It was a calm, clean, and comfortable space that gave us both a much-needed break. I‚Äôd join in the play or just relax while he explored.

But things changed after the remodel (1/16/2025). They added a huge, loud, blinking video game with sound effects and background music that fill the entire space. Instead of pretend play and climbing, some kids now just stand in front of the screen, cracking blocks endlessly‚Äîcrack, crack, crack, bump, bump, bump, explode, explode. To make it worse, the game changes themes every few minutes, constantly drawing kids back for more.

The game does have an auto-shutdown feature: if no one plays it for a while, it will turn off for 10 minutes. But with so many kids attracted to it, that rarely happens.

My kiddo didn‚Äôt even touch the game, but the noise and flashing lights were impossible to avoid. He couldn‚Äôt concentrate on the slide, the toolset, or any of the other toys he used to love. By the time we left, he (and even I) was overstimulated and overtired. It was exhausting for both of us.

The staff was nice enough to lower the volume a bit and promptly refunded my pass when I asked. I appreciate their help, but the experience left me feeling disappointed. This used to be such a pleasant space for creative, hands-on play, and now it‚Äôs a struggle to find something similar for rainy days.

If they ever remove the video game or limit its impact, I‚Äôd gladly come back. If you feel the same, please consider leaving a review. Hopefully, they‚Äôll see how much their choices affect families like ours and make some changes.
