Reviewer: N Patterson
Rating: 4/5
Time: Edited 7 months ago
Review: November 2024 Edit:
We‚Äôve been back a few times to this indoor space and have seen several positive improvements. They no longer seem to allow strollers in the play area, which opens up the space considerably. There are an ever-increasing number of toys and play options, many of which are quite unique and fun for a variety of ages (my now three year old loves the hamster wheel and jumparoo in particular). There are no longer schedules play sessions, your time (one or two hour increments) starts when you arrive. It has been very clean each time we‚Äôve been there. It continues to be an excellent play space for small toddlers, and they have several class options for older kids. We love this play space more and more each visit, especially as the weather starts to change.

We‚Äôve been eagerly waiting for this place to open, there are few indoor play spots for toddlers in this area! We booked a play spot for my 2.5 year old on opening day for the standard price of $30. My child happily and safely played for the entire two hour session. I supervised and played along, but never had to intervene or redirect.

General Observations:
-Although targeted at ages 8 and under, this is designed for the preschool and under set. If you have a young toddler and fear other places where bigger kids run them over, this is a great spot. At 2.5 years, my child was one of the older children there. There was only one child over four in our play session today and they were obviously bored after 20 minutes and complaining about all the ‚Äúbabies‚Äù.
-There are few toys. This isn‚Äôt necessarily a bad thing, but it means that if one kid cleans out the ‚Äúkitchen‚Äù area and moves everything to the ‚Äústore‚Äù area, there are literally no toys left in the kitchen area. Since the staff doesn‚Äôt clean between sessions, the ‚Äústore‚Äù isn‚Äôt restocked until another child moves stuff back. There were like five dress up outfits total.
-It‚Äôs expensive, but Redmond is expensive in general. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs outlandishly priced, but it‚Äôs pricier than KidsQuest on a per-visit basis (and MUCH higher membership and party fees) with far less space. I can‚Äôt fathom paying $60 for two children to play in this small space.
-the advertised play space of 3k feet is a bit misleading. There‚Äôs a big party room, spacious family bathrooms, and a staff area included in the square footage.

What I Love:
-Great play options for preschool and under
-Limited sensory overload - classical music is playing softly, colors are muted, there‚Äôs not an overwhelming number of choices for littles.
-climbing area is FANTASTIC. Lots of challenging options with safe landings.
-Two hour play window is perfect for littles.
-The play space is self enclosed and everything is safe for littles. If you want to let your kid roam freely without constantly hovering, this is the perfect space. I imagine it‚Äôs perfect for weekday play dates while parents drink coffee and chat.

What I Didn‚Äôt Love:
-Play spots are back-to-back. Staff does not clean, sanitize, or organize between sessions like in other similar indoor play places.
-Strollers are allowed in the play space. It‚Äôs a small and tight space, and shoes aren‚Äôt allowed. However, multiple strollers were in the play space during our season, which made the area seem super cramped. Kids were running into each other and said strollers. It kind of defeats the no shoes rule, since the stroller tires track dirt and germs everywhere.
-Play areas seem incomplete. This might change, given it was opening day. There were five total dress up outfits. A cool ball maze on the wall was missing any balls to drop down it (so the toddlers dropped blocks, which led to obvious problems). The cash register in the grocery store was to small and not secured, and I watched several toddlers swing it around and drop it on other kids‚Äô feet.

We‚Äôll be back occasionally on rainy days when local play options are limited.

Review: We recently threw a birthday party for our daughter who just turned 4 at Kids Magic Lab, and it was such a great choice! After doing a ton of research on different venues, I‚Äôm so glad we went with this one. My daughter and her friends had the best time. The kids ranged from 9 months to 6 years old, both boys and girls, and there was something fun for everyone.

They had so many pretend play options, tons of costumes that the kids loved, and a small gym area that was a huge hit. Here are a few things we really liked about the place:

1. Outside catering allowed: This was a big plus because it gave us full control over the food we wanted to serve. Super flexible!
2. Exclusive booking: You can book the entire place, which was perfect for a more intimate party. There's a play area and a separate party room. We had around 50 guests (20 kids and 30 adults), and the party room space was just right for our group.
3. Kid-friendly setup: The space isn‚Äôt too big, so parents didn‚Äôt feel like they had to constantly chase after their kids. It made it so much easier to relax and chat with other parents without worrying about keeping an eye on the little ones.
4. Decorations included: Their party package comes with basic decorations, which was a nice bonus! I requested a pastel color palette, and they totally nailed it.
5. Great location: Kids Magic Lab is in Redmond Town Center, which is a perfect spot if you want to keep the fun going after the party! After our 2-hour booking, the kids still had energy, so they continued playing at the nearby splash pad. Plus, there‚Äôs plenty of parking, which was super convenient.

Overall, we had a great experience with the staff too. They were really responsive via email and helpful throughout. The only thing I would mention is that while the website says the party package includes ‚Äúpaper goods‚Äù and ‚Äúparty helpers for setup and cleanup,‚Äù they actually charge an additional $50 for supplies and cleanup. It would've been nice if that was more upfront, but other than that, no complaints!

If you're looking for a fun, stress-free party spot for young kids, I highly recommend Kids Magic Lab!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley

Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. Reviewer: Amanda Baremore (Mom What‚Äôs Next CDA)
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Experience the world of soft play, where kids can play in a safe environment with soft surfaces and equipment. Northwest Soft Play center in Post Falls is a great space for all ages, but is primarily focused towards the younger crowd. The ideal age for this center would be 8 months- 4yo, though you can bring kids up to 8yo.

Everything is soft, fun and safe for all ages. There is no sharp edges, bark or metal bars. The floor, stairs, and toys are all soft play based & geared towards toddlers. Soft play environments allow your child to gain confidence in their exploring while being safe!

You will find activities that include a ball pit, slides, a soft play castle, bouncy animals, interactive toys, rotating soft octopus, and lots more. There is also a small space for children that are crawling to explore & play. MUST WEAR SOCKS at all times.

I like wow what great service. When I was filling out the form I had to ask her for the time a few times over because she over there taking selfies . I believe a business should be more welcoming and professional at least. Then the fact you get charge for a baby who isn‚Äôt even going to play , my baby sat on my lap the whole time just like I said she would but the lady charged her anyway saying just in case she wants to play . We definitely won‚Äôt be going again, I don‚Äôt like businesses that make you feel like an inconvenience.

Reviewer: Kailey Sanetti
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: If I could give this place zero stars I would..

This business got new owners in August 2024. We've also been 3 times since the new owners. All 3 for birthday parties, one in August 2023, once in January 2024 and once in March 2024 and all 3 visits we have come home with either pink eye or hand foot and mouth, or this last time, March 2024 we got both pink eye and hand foot and mouth. My kids wear socks and I sanitize their hands multiple times as well as wash with soap multiple times during playing and after we leave. I don't believe that they sanitize this structure at all.

Jokes on us for coming all 3 times that we have, but we will not be giving this business our time or money anymore..  we had thought it was weird the last two time we came home with pink eye or hand foot and mouth, but we had also been to a couple other kids places but this time. We are in a move and hadn‚Äôt gone anywhere other than the grocery store in 12 days before we went here for a party, so we know without a doubt that it came from this business.. and our pediatrician has also mentioned that several cases of this has come in since August with a lot of them having frequented this play area shortly before‚Ä¶

Mind you, we went 5-7 times from April- July when we first moved here because they had discount Tuesdays, where it was half off on Tuesday, and we had never gotten anything from this place besides a stuffy nose which is common when taking toddlers to a play area.. but the fact that we've gotten pink eye and hand foot and mouth twice now in 6 months is unacceptable...

The joke of the pricing at this business since the new owners have taken over in August 2020 is laughable. They just released their "summer savings" and it's $250 per child to go for ONE HOUR A DAY for a SINGLE MONTH. Who is the freaking economy can afford that, if they have more than one child... and that's just the LOWEST TEIR of their supposed "savings"  this place is a disgusting joke and I wouldn't waste your money.

Review: We went to try this place out for the first time today, my daughter was playing up in the jungle gym area, and slipped off of the balance beam and her leg fell through the netting and she got stuck. I ran to try and pull her out she was screaming I tried to pull her out but she was still stuck. We were both screaming for help, not a single staff was to be found. Luckily a grandma and another lady came running over trying to help, she was too stuck we couldn't get her leg to budge. So we ended up having to cut the net finally after 10 minutes of my daughter being stuck a staff who was only a teenager come over but instead of helping she just stood there despite us asking multiple time for her to get scissors. Finally the other mom came running with the scissors and cut my daughter out. Staff never once apologized or even approached me. An older staff what I would assume was a manager was called and when she arrived she also did not even approach me or say anything instead they were just freaking out about having to now repaired the netting. My daughters leg is extremely bruised.

Reviewer: Brittany Mashburn
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: As a mom of two little girls ages 3 & 4, I know how impossible it is to find a clean & ‚Äúyoung kid‚Äù friendly place where my girls can go play without me having to follow them around like a helicopter to make sure they are safe. The high top tables at Little Pandas lets me keep an eye on them while still enjoying a tasty drink. They entertain themselves and always find another kiddo to play with.

Now for the more important part of this review; I have read through some of these other reviews and I am shocked at what I have read!

-The owners (husband and wife) both introduced themselves to us when we first checked this spot out and we have had multiple great interactions with them since! They are a huge reason I decided to grab the membership because I truly feel that this is a safe environment for my girls and I.
Even my daughters love looking for them when we arrive.

-the owners should NOT be policing your children! Watch your kids, make sure they are playing nicely and if they are stealing toys from kids or running and being wild, HANDLE THAT YOURSELF! This is not a daycare!

-If anyone going to this place has children, you know how hard it is to keep a play room clean and organized when there are multiple kids running around and dumping toys out. How many of your kids actually put things back where they found it at this age?! I have seen their employees walk the play area cleaning and organizing which I think is great. But then 3 seconds later, I see kids dumping toys back out.

-I am a business owner myself and can appreciate that this couple is trying to provide for their kids and still get work done while their NEWBORN baby sleeps in the stroller right next to them. They don‚Äôt need to talk with you or focus all on you. Enjoy their space and let them be business owners/ parents!

-If you hate crowds or going when it‚Äôs busy, then don‚Äôt go during their peak hours! It‚Äôs as simple as that. Same thing with going to the Everett‚Äôs children museum! Don‚Äôt go to a kid place on a weekend and then be shocked that it is busy. You learn what times are the busiest or most crowded and you avoid it. The building is only so big! Use common sense. They literally offer cheaper play during their slower day and times.

-They even go above and beyond to provide FREE diapers and wipes in their bathrooms because they are also parents and know that sometimes we forget and need those extras! Those small touches in my eyes are amazing.

-this isn‚Äôt a restaurant! They offer the usual toddler snacks and some tasty pastries plus fun drinks. Bring your own snacks if this isn‚Äôt enough for you. Or hit one of the many restaurants located on the same street.

- People will always find something to complain about or use hurtful statements when they are jealous of something. This family created a  beautiful place that most moms are just wishing to find when they need a minute without having their kids climb all over them and their kids can go burn off energy while interacting nicely with other kids. This is that place üêºüñ§

Reviewer: Dayna Sakanashi
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My catchphrase is: Google doesn't lie! Most review apps/sites (looking at you, Yelp) are rife with ridiculous reviewers complaining about unrealistic or down right insulting criticisms...

But the parents at this cafe have given mostly stellar reviews and I agree - it's organized, has a clean bathroom very close by, the cafe has tasty chicken empanadas and other goodies, plenty of seating, and a wonderful play area for kids mostly 3 and under. I brought my toddler and he LOVED it here.

It's nice that there's a variety of play: toys, make believe structures, a playground structure, and area for infants.

There's tons of moms and parents that fill up the place. That's something the cafe can't control other than the max occupancy but honestly it's a good sign that it's so popular. It can get crowded and a bit loud, but for a weekday morning the kids can still run around and I thought it was honestly not bad noise level wise.

It's very affordable. I've been to many places that you need to either pay hourly or for an unlimited day pass but it's usually kind of dirty. Here, they have an affordable price (check their site) and we ended up staying for almost 3 hours! Now that's a deal.

When we sat down for lunch, my kid looked out the big windows and kept pointing at the cars/vehicles passing down the road! It was the reason why we ended up buying a 5-Day pass!

The part that made me appreciate this cafe was the customer service. Two ladies at the front were amazing and always so welcoming - they communicated everything about our order from how long it would take to even offering to reheat it (my toddler needed a diaper change). We can't wait to come back!

PS: There's a Goodwill across the parking lot so that's a bonus. More reasons to stop by here.

Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

The old play area he loved has been condensed and shoved to the side and is much smaller. The place is now extremely chaotic and there are a lot more bigger kids there that would push him around. It‚Äôs really too bad. This place used to be a good place to bring your kids with special needs. Kind of like the discovery zone. Now it‚Äôs something for older kids activities. Don‚Äôt eat the pizza. It is a bit pricey as well and beware using the bathrooms.

Reviewer: K Nichole
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Came in today w my 1 yr old & 3 y/o twins for something to do in the -temps. We had a blast. My baby learned how to climb & go down slides & my toddlers found a new love for swinging/spinning (egg swing is what we called it).

If you're looking for a safe space for your kiddos to play where parents are tentative to their children, this is it. We didn't have to worry about any unsupervised kids. Door is heavy enough to where if a kiddo did run off, they wouldn't be able to exit. & the place isn't big to where you feel overwhelmed. You can see your child from any location in the room.

The place was clean. The bathrooms were clean as well, no odors or messes. Bonus points for the rubber flooring that makes falls easier to handle. & the couches placed throughout so parents have somewhere to sit. Offially our favorite local indoor place for the littles. Safe. Fun. Friendly.

reviews:
{Reviewer: Rictorshoue
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My son absolutely loves Ahoy Kitsap Playland, and it's become one of our favorite go-to spots in Kitsap! We visit often, and every time, he has a blast ‚Äî especially with the slides. The whole place is incredibly kid-friendly and safe, which gives me peace of mind as a parent.
The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming. It's clear the staff cares about maintaining a fun and safe environment. One of the best things is that parents can actually sit back and relax while the kids play. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, good visibility of the play areas, and free Wi-Fi ‚Äî a rare and much-appreciated combination for any indoor play space.
Ahoy Kitsap Playland strikes a great balance between active fun for kids and a laid-back vibe for parents. I highly recommend it to any families looking for a safe, fun, and clean place to let their little ones burn off some energy!

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley

Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: I P
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. You‚Äôll leave happier than a kitten with a ball of yarn.

Reviewer: TIANXU ZANG
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We have been playing at Ocean Play for more than half a year now. This is my kids' favorite indoor playground in the Hillsboro area.

Location:
Ocean Play is conveniently located in a plaza, making it easy to go shopping after playtime. It also has plenty of parking space, so I never worry about finding a spot.

Service:
The service at Ocean Play is excellent. The place is always clean, and I feel very safe when my kids are running around. They also offer some snacks to eat and free Wi-Fi service. The restrooms are very clean as well. If they have a party event, they always post the latest schedule on Google beforehand.

Cost:
It is cheaper to play during weekdays. However, the best money-saving tip is to buy their punch card (if you live close by and your kids like the place).

The playground has lots of attractions that my kids enjoy. As the saying goes, "a picture is worth a thousand words."

Reviewer: A B
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: We did a private rental of Ocean Plays for our child‚Äôs birthday party over the weekend. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the humble exterior: the facility is fantastic, but first I need to rave about the staff. We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation time to find the facility closed and two staff members, Rayna and another wonderful lady (sorry I missed your name!) cleaning, sanitizing, and tidying up the entire place. When we went in, they were beyond helpful‚Äîasking what they could do and making suggestions as to how we could most efficiently use the space. They offered to carry in supplies from our car, set up the decor and party signs, brought tape and scissors for things we needed, everything. They never once were bossy or restrictive, and instead were the most gracious and helpful people. They even popped on masks without being asked as they noticed our party was wearing them. Nothing was too big of an ask for them, and they coordinated things I hadn‚Äôt even thought of, such as when to do cake, rounding up the children for dinner, cleaning up spills, offering bootie covers for parents who didn‚Äôt wish to remove their shoes, everything. I just can‚Äôt get over how extremely helpful they were. The facility was perfect for our party of approximately fifty people with still more room to spare. The kids in attendance ranged from 1.5 to 10 years old and everyone had an awesome time. There were slides, a ball pit, climbing things, and shooting cannons (which were not loud or startling at all for our group, which included some sensitive kids). Everything looked new‚Äîno rips or duct taped patches, crushed balls, or dirty floors. For the adults there were lovely couches with electrical socket plugs and massage chairs. They also offer snacks and drinks for a reasonable fee, and there are two individual restrooms. There is a huge emphasis on cleanliness and hand sanitizer was placed everywhere. The main area alongside the play area had the couches and tables that held everyone comfortably, and there was also a smaller side room that had two tables and a long table running the length of the wall, perfect for our pizza bar. We brought in outside food‚Äîhuge plus to be able to do that, though they do offer delivery of pizza schmizza. At the end of the party we did no cleanup‚Äîit was so stress-free. For all of this service and private rental of the full space, where you don‚Äôt have to worry about strangers or kids wandering off, the price was beyond reasonable. I highly recommend a party at Ocean Plays.

The owner called me and apologized for what happened and said she will be talking with this employee and wants us to come back in to have a better experience. She was super nice and genuinely sorry. We will be going back to give them another shot.

Today was our 2nd time going and I was so disappointed. It was so busy which made it a bit overwhelming. The lady that was working today had her 2 daughters there. They were running around all over the place like banshees and climbing on top of all of the furniture (standing on top of the bakery area, climbing the playset in the middle like a rock wall, etc). There were a few times where they almost ran into my son while they were running around crazy. The whole time this was happening, their mom was sitting up front on her phone. I don't care if you have your children there while you're working. But if all parents are required to supervise their children, then employees should be required too. Or don't bring your kids to work if they don't know how to behave in public. And on top of all of that, they were playing songs with swear words. How is that appropriate for a children's play place? My 1st time here, I loved it. Which is why I came back for a 2nd time. But after today, I'm not sure if I will come back. Not trying to deal with my son listening to inappropriate music while having to make sure he doesn't get hurt by older kids acting crazy.

4. The owners *truly* care. This is a small business, and the cost is worth it!

We tried Kids Wonder and other indoor play places, and really struggled with bigger kids (5+) running full speed, slick concrete floors, and spending too much money on maybe 2 hours of playtime.

We had a terrible experience at We Play on a rainy day with our 20-month-old. To start, the pricing is ridiculous. When my husband mentioned he wouldn‚Äôt even enter the playground, they still insisted he purchase socks.

Once we got inside, it was utter chaos. There‚Äôs no structure or staff oversight. In the toddler section, my son tried to interact with another child while playing with a toy ice cream stand, only to be pushed repeatedly by the other child. This happened three times before the other parent finally intervened‚Äîafter we called out for them. Most parents were sitting on the sidelines glued to their phones, oblivious to their kids‚Äô behavior.

The worst part was in the ‚Äú4 and under‚Äù section, where older kids were spinning dangerously fast on a toy, hanging off the sides and running recklessly around it. My son was simply walking nearby when they knocked him over. There was no staff monitoring this area, no one enforcing age limits, and no one available to address safety concerns.

This place is a disaster. If you‚Äôre looking for a safe, structured, and enjoyable environment for your child, do not come here. It‚Äôs overpriced, poorly managed, and unsafe. We will not be returning.

Reviewer: Ri
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Respectfully, please read.
1. This business is not a daycare, meaning; you as a parent are responsible for watching your children. The staff is assigned with other duties; attending to kids is not one of them. Yet, you are highly encouraged to advise the manger-on-site or a staff member if you notice any misdemeanor. There's a mic at the stage that the manager can use to pull the parents' attention towards their kids or announce emergencies, etc.
2. If you have a birthday party and you purchase a package with only 50 plates & forks, the party planners will set your order based off of the order sheet - Example: If your guests throw their plates or forks away after food and not have any left for cake, it's not the staff's fault. Please plan ahead or ask to purchase the additional items if you need more and they should be provided accordingly.
3. Everything should be accounted for. The staff are employees and cannot make financial decisions on behalf of the business, kindly do not ask for items without payment if they were not included on your party package.
4. Don't leave your shoes or your kid shoes laying around on the ground - there are cubbies for a reason.
Kids are free to run in this place and therefore it should be safe place and clear of any obstacle, including shoes.
6. If you have any concerns, please do not hesitate to ask for the manager at site while you're there and they'll do their best to assist.
Thank you for taking the time to read this.  I hope it helps everyone have a better experience :)

Reviewer: Natacia Hanson
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 4 months ago
Review: This place is super cute and fun for the kids, but my review is in reference to hosting a birthday party. I just want to warn other parents that this place is going to try and charge you more for their party by saying you went "over your time." The day we threw our party it seemed like they were understaffed my hosts were spread way too thin.  We were supposed to be out of our room by 4 PM, which we were but because the hosts did not start cleaning until 3:50 PM they did not have the room ready by 4. They automatically charged my card without even saying anything to me. They made up various lies that I was told we would be charged and warned to clean up 3 times. This NEVER happened. We started cleaning up on our own and had our first warning (which they claimed was the third) by the manager Judy.

About 4:10 PM my host asked if I wanted to take the ballons provided by the venue and I stepped in the room to grab them. They claim since I was briefly in the room at this time, I was over my party time. This is extremely unsettling because it seems like they are trying to trick their clients in order to charge them more for the overall party. The whole experience was unfortunately very negative. I spoke with Amy regarding the matter and even though she admitted the staff made some mistakes and warnings were never given there was no solution to my problem due to the above photo. I just don't think client should be charged for overage if this ensued due to their staffing delays.

Response from company reply:

I would never try and smear your name because I have only had great experiences until this point. I never resisted cleaning up and this is why I wrote this review.  To be accused of this, is very upsetting because it never happened. I was literally cleaning up when she came in the room.

After talking with the staff, Amy apologized to me that in fact that hosts never did ask me to clean and up and my first and only warning was by Judy. We were already cleaning when Judy came in but moved very quickly after this. I was recovering from surgery at the time so I moved as quickly as I could, but I had help from family as well. You also recognized that Judy never did okay this additional charge with me so the initial information you have was in fact false. I appreciate you owning these mistakes, but to still be charged for stepping into a room to grab ballons offered to me is ridiculous.

Reviewer: Brittany DeCost
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Kudos to the manager on shift tonight! There was an incident involving my daughter and another child. My daughter repeatedly asked this child to remove his hands off of her leg as he was holding onto her and shaking her on the rope. She was scared. The child refused to stop! Once the child was identified, the manager was made aware of the situation because by this time the child had now now only grabbed my daughter and held onto her by the foot while shaking her he had also placed his hands on at least 3 other children.

The child's "guardian" was made aware that at this institution, we keep our hands to ourselves! Come to find out
1. The child did have disabilities (ok I get this and he has a difficult time understanding to keep his hands to himself) but now we ask! Where are the parents!?!
2. Said child was with a BABYSITTER!
3. After manager speaks to child and babysitter the parents of child call and scream at the manager.

Let's get things straight, if I were in your shoes and my daughter had disabilities and needed DIRECT SUPERVISION so I could intervene if she was placing her hands on others id make sure I was SUPERVISING MY CHILD!  I would not blame the manager for addressing my child for placing hands on others. That's her job! Keep kids safe and having fun in a safe environment!

I would also be questioning who is babysitting my child because while your babysitter was sitting on her a$$ your child was hitting a 2 year old!

Again. Kudos to the manager for addressing the situation as soon as it was brought to her attention. Thank you for helping my daughter feel safe and welcome. And just thank you for being you. I'm horrible with names and I cannot remember if she said it was Julie or Judy. But either way. Your an amazing manager. You have the patience of a saint and I appreciate you.

To the parents of the child who needs to be taught to keep their hands to their selves because regardless of a disability or not, this does not give your child the right to place his hands on my daughter. No means no. I hope you find a babysitter who actually watches your children instead of sitting on one of those comfy chairs and plays on her phone the entire time.

Reviewer: Lori Lee
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This is not the place to go to just play in an indoor playground if it's crowded. It's not on the grand scale of like a Chuck E Cheese that can be busy and yet still seem like there's room and you're not tripping over each other or trying to find your child through the crowd. Being a smaller place, when it's crowded and kids are all on the same thing, trying to go down the same slide, waiting to play one of the arcade games, etc, then what was going to be a fun time turns into chaos. I spent more time trying to see them thru the crowd and keep them off of other kids, to not take cuts, to be careful, or telling them they had to be patient to wait for this game and with younger kids that's just becomes a headache. I think it's great for a birthday party, again, try and set that party up for when it's not crowded/busy. Where it shines is the stage and special events it hosts. I've talked to many friends who have went there for the special events and have just loved it. The pizza bar & food prices are typical of this type of place but it does have a coffee and drinking bar for the adults which is nice. Overall I think it's great for the special events and birthday parties if you can get them at a down time. IMO I just don't think it's a place you can decide to just jump in the car and go. Because of its size, w/ younger kids it's too small for "anytime I want to go" play.

Reviewer: Rachel Bourgoin, LMFT
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: The Kids Landing is such a necessary need for Castle Rock and boy does it deliver BIG!! I swear they have thought of everything- from a toddler play area to a flight simulator section to the play structure even being parent friendly! Wow!! As a mom of 2 under 2 I am limited with where I can take my kids and it be somewhere affordable, small kid friendly, easy access for parents to play or supervise their kids, and not have to drive 20+ minutes to. My daughter is 21 months and she LOVED it! The toddler area was perfect for containment and getting her comfortable before wanting to venture to the play structure. She wasn‚Äôt brave enough to go on her own, so my husband (who is 6 feet tall) went with her. He was able to navigate through the entire play structure with ease (which is SUPER impressive since most structures are small, cramped, and definitely only for kids which IMO isn‚Äôt great for the small ones who still need mom or dad‚Äôs help). After she went through the structure and down the slides one time we couldn‚Äôt pry her away. My husband and I took turns going through with her (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô3‚Äù and had no issues going through which is no surprise since my husband-again 6 feet tall- was able to run around with my daughter as well). She LOVED our time there and we will definitely become members. Perfect timing since winter is right around the corner and we need all the great indoor ideas and places. Will definitely be frequenting here and adding to our weekly routine. My daughter‚Äôs birthday is in January and it‚Äôs so hard to find things to do indoors that isn‚Äôt at our house. We will be renting the event room for sure!! It‚Äôs the perfect size and the glass walls allow parents to enjoy themselves and watch their kids. I am SO thankful for a safe, locally run and owned indoor play place for our kiddos. The owners are also such wonderful people. I love that they live here and want to invest in making Castle Rock better. The prices are more than reasonable and honestly could probably be higher so myself (and bank account) are thankful it‚Äôs more than affordable. Such an amazing addition to our community! Support local and enjoy your new favorite place to take your kiddos!!

Side note- I am not a fan of snacks with the first ingredient being high fructose corn syrup or that have massive amounts of added sugar. It‚Äôs refreshing to see an establishment that provides healthy snacks kids still love. Dried apples (or fruits) are favorites in my house and I haven‚Äôt met a kid that doesn‚Äôt like them. & thinking of the parents with protein bars, genius!! We need fuel too and rarely do I remember to pack snacks for me so THANK YOU!!
I also appreciate the no alcohol policy-  as a parent who expects other parents to ‚Äúparent‚Äù their children instead of using play areas for babysitting while they drink, this is the type of place I want to support.

Lastly- I‚Äôm sorry for the previous review. It was distasteful and not a truthful representation of your facility. I personally know you‚Äôre local and native to Colorado . Plus, no one should make public comments about your marriage when they do not know you or your financial/marital situation.

Review: As a restaurant owner, I am not typically one to leave bad reviews‚Äîbut I absolutely have to address something that happened today. I purchased a $16 cheese and fruit plate that was full of old/bruised fruit. I kindly asked if they could remake the plate because my children have sensory issues and wouldn‚Äôt eat the fruit. When they remade it, they gave us less than HALF the food that was on the original plate. When I asked them where the rest of the cheese was, they said ‚Äúthe cheese assortment is at random, that‚Äôs just how we do it.‚Äù It was insanely busy and I didn‚Äôt want to cause any delays for other families, but I am SO disappointed. They served me slivers of apple peels on the second plate, FOUR crackers, and a small pile of Swiss cheese that my children obviously wouldn‚Äôt eat. I feel like they did this deliberately, as the employees looked annoyed I even brought the plate to their attention. For $16, food should be fresh and stored properly to avoid bruising and spoiling. They would not give me a refund. Though my kids love this place, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be visiting again because of the blatant disrespect. I spend hundreds of dollars here a month, so I expected a little more kindness and care. The first photo is what they initially served me, and the second photo is what the replacement plate had on it.

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

-----------------------

Reviewer: I P
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. You‚Äôll leave happier than a kitten with a ball of yarn.

Reviewer: Thomas Harris
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited PlayCafe with my two young children, and I have to say, it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. Owners Matt and Michelle have truly created a haven that perfectly caters to both children and their parents.

From the moment we walked in, it was clear that Matt and Michelle understand the unique needs of young families. The play area is incredibly well-designed, with a variety of safe, engaging activities that kept my kids entertained for hours. Every corner of the space is thoughtfully arranged to spark imagination and encourage active play, from the colorful climbing structures to the creative play stations.

What truly sets PlayCafe apart, though, is how well they accommodate parents. The seating area is comfortable and strategically placed so that you can keep an eye on your little ones while enjoying a well-deserved break. The caf√© offers a great selection of refreshments, from freshly brewed coffee to healthy snacks, making it easy to relax and refuel.

Moreover, the entire facility is impeccably clean and well-maintained, which is a testament to the care and dedication Matt and Michelle put into their business. They are always on hand to greet you with a warm smile and are genuinely invested in ensuring that every family has a positive experience.

In a world where finding a place that both children and parents can enjoy equally is rare, PlayCafe stands out as a true gem. It's clear that Matt and Michelle have poured their hearts into creating a space that understands and meets the needs of families. I highly recommend PlayCafe to anyone looking for an all-around great place for kids to play and parents to relax. We will definitely be returning soon!

We had a terrible experience at We Play on a rainy day with our 20-month-old. To start, the pricing is ridiculous. Once we got inside, it was utter chaos. There‚Äôs no structure or staff oversight. In the toddler section, my son tried to interact with another child while playing with a toy ice cream stand, only to be pushed repeatedly by the other child. This happened three times before the other parent finally intervened‚Äîafter we called out for them. Most parents were sitting on the sidelines glued to their phones, oblivious to their kids‚Äô behavior.

The worst part was in the ‚Äú4 and under‚Äù section, where older kids were spinning dangerously fast on a toy, hanging off the sides and running recklessly around it. My son was simply walking nearby when they knocked him over. There was no staff monitoring this area, no one enforcing age limits, and no one available to address safety concerns.

This place is a disaster. If you‚Äôre looking for a safe, structured, and enjoyable environment for your child, do not come here. It‚Äôs overpriced, poorly managed, and unsafe. We will not be returning.

Reviewer: Abigail Buckley
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Overall we had a positive experience letting our kids play at Junebug, but a few things I noticed that seemed different than what I expected. Other than a giant ballpit, there were no other play structures or spaces that seemed to be designed for more active play. There were so many wonderful spaces for imaginative and creative play, which my daughter loved. But I know my son was looking for more opportunities to get his energy out.
They have a small more baby friendly corner, but it is not closed off from the rest of the play space. And the rest of the space has several non-baby friendly toys that present choking hazards.
The creative play spaces are all closed off in mini cubicles. So if you have multiple children, it is impossible to keep eyes on all of them at once, making the small toys an extra choking concern.
If you have older toddlers or young kiddos, this space would be great for you! (The kiddo potty and sink in the restroom were a big hit with our toddlers!)
But I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for mamas with babies or younger toddlers who still put small items in their mouths. And it‚Äôs not ideal when looking for a place to let your kids run and play to get their energy out.

title: Wild Child Indoor Playground
workhours: Saturday, 10‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Sunday, 10‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Monday, 9‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Tuesday, 9‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Wednesday, 9‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Thursday, 9‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours; Friday, 9‚ÄØam to 6‚ÄØpm, Copy open hours;
reviews:
{Reviewer: Lauren Quinn
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

We had such a fantastic time at Wild Child inside Valley View Mall in La Crosse! This indoor playground is an absolute gem for families with little ones. There‚Äôs such a wide variety of toys and play structures that kept our almost 23 month old boy happily entertained the entire visit. From imaginative play to climbing and crawling, there‚Äôs truly something for every age and interest.

One feature we especially loved was the separate, sectioned-off area for children 2 and under. While younger kiddos can absolutely enjoy the entire play area, it‚Äôs really thoughtful and comforting to have a space just for them to explore more safely and at their own pace.

Everything was very clean, well-maintained, and clearly cared for‚Äîwhich makes a big difference in a space like this! The snack and drink vending machine was also a much-appreciated bonus for parents and kiddos who need a quick break and refreshment without having to leave the space.

Highly recommend Wild Child to anyone with young kids looking for indoor fun in La Crosse! We‚Äôll definitely be back.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Alex
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Wild Child is an amazing indoor playground for smaller kids. My kiddo is three and it is perfect for her. It is the cleanest play area I've ever seen. Staff members regularly clean the toys and keep everything tidy. I highly recommend Wild Child.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Miranda Ham

Reviewer: Ginja Ninja
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Wildchild Indoor Playground is an absolute blast for kids of all ages! From the moment we walked in, the vibrant colors and exciting energy were contagious. My children, ages 3 and 7, were immediately captivated by the variety of play structures. The multi-level climbing area kept my older one engaged, while the dedicated toddler zone provided a safe and stimulating environment for my youngest.
What truly impressed me was the cleanliness and the attentive staff. The entire facility was spotless, and the staff members were friendly, helpful, and clearly focused on ensuring everyone's safety and enjoyment. It's such a relief to find a place where kids can burn off energy in a secure and well-maintained setting.
Wildchild offers more than just climbing and sliding; the interactive games and obstacle courses added an extra layer of fun and challenge. It's the perfect spot for a rainy day adventure or just a fun outing to get the wiggles out. We left with two happy, tired kids and can't wait to visit Wildchild again soon! Highly recommend!! Live your best life!

Review: Compact FREE indoor playground for toddlers to Kindergarten children. Just need to scan ID at the front. No age limit although parent supervision is required all the time.

Playground equipment, kitchen toy, kids tables, book & carpet area, big blocks and 2 bouncy houses. Table and chairs along the wall for easy supervision.
No food or beverage allowed in the playroom.

You can rent a room in front of the playroom for a birthday party etc. $50/h, minimum 2 hours. The playroom remains open to everybody even if you rent the room for a party.

At 2024 Jan bowling alley is not in operation.

reviews:
{Reviewer: Rictorshoue
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My son absolutely loves Ahoy Kitsap Playland, and it's become one of our favorite go-to spots in Kitsap! We visit often, and every time, he has a blast ‚Äî especially with the slides. The whole place is incredibly kid-friendly and safe, which gives me peace of mind as a parent.
The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming. It's clear the staff cares about maintaining a fun and safe environment. One of the best things is that parents can actually sit back and relax while the kids play. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, good visibility of the play areas, and free Wi-Fi ‚Äî a rare and much-appreciated combination for any indoor play space.
Ahoy Kitsap Playland strikes a great balance between active fun for kids and a laid-back vibe for parents. I highly recommend it to any families looking for a safe, fun, and clean place to let their little ones burn off some energy!

The virtual reality area is pretty cool but I‚Äôm not sure if the price overall is really worth it to go all the time. Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Your experience here will depend heavily on 1. Time of day and 2. Which staff are working 3. How busy it is.  If you want to book a party I'd recommend an after hours one so your party goers are the only ones there unless it is going to be a small party.
I have to agree with the other reviews that say that it is kind of getting to that point where they are going to need to temporarily shut down and revamp. At first glance it looks pretty clean but like the other say if you look closely, the tape is wearing off and foam tiles are coming apart, etc. But gotta say of all the play places, it is the lowest stimulus and I feel safe letting my 3 year old run about without having to be right on top of her.

Reviewer: cindycevc
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: If You‚Äôre Planning a Party Here, Read This First‚Äù

I had visited this place before for a playdate and had a good experience, so I decided to book my daughter‚Äôs birthday party here. The space itself is nice ‚Äî there‚Äôs a big area for kids, a smaller section for toddlers, and the bathrooms were clean and modern.

But if you‚Äôre thinking of booking a party here, there are several things you should really be aware of ‚Äî and some things the business seriously needs to improve.

1. Check-in/Check-out Process:
Their system is slow and outdated. They use a highlighter pen to write random letters on each person‚Äôs wrist when they arrive, then check the mark under a UV light when people leave. On a busy day, this creates a huge backup at the front, with long lines of people trying to get in and out. Some kids in my party didn‚Äôt even get their wrist marked properly, so the staff didn‚Äôt know who their parents were at pickup ‚Äî I had to step in and confirm identities. It‚Äôs stressful, disorganized, and needs to be replaced with something more efficient.

2. No Help During the Party:
If you book a party, you‚Äôre basically on your own. I had over 20 kids, and they only gave me two small tables that barely seated 10. I asked for an extra table ‚Äî no one brought it, so I ended up grabbing one myself from another room. There‚Äôs no assigned staff to help or check in on you. Anything you need (a lighter, garbage bags, etc.), you have to go downstairs and ask for it yourself ‚Äî which takes up even more of your short 2-hour time slot.

3. No Party Announcements (This Was a Big Issue):
One of the most frustrating things was that they have no microphone or PA system to make announcements. You know how most places say things like, ‚ÄúHey kids, come back to Mariana‚Äôs party table for cake!‚Äù? That doesn‚Äôt exist here. I had to physically search the whole (very large) play area to find all the kids in our group when it was time for food and cake. I even brought colored necklaces to identify the kids, and it still didn‚Äôt help much. When I asked staff if they could make an announcement, they said, ‚ÄúOh, we don‚Äôt do that.‚Äù With only two hours for the entire party, I easily lost 20‚Äì30 minutes just trying to round everyone up. It was a mess. This is something they really need to fix ‚Äî it‚Äôs a basic necessity for running organized parties.

4. Time Pressure and Rushed Cleanup:
Parties are booked back-to-back, so you have to be completely out by your end time ‚Äî not just cleaning up, but out of the party room. At 4:15 sharp, I was still trying to clean up and get kids out, but the next group was already arriving. It felt rushed and chaotic, and staff didn‚Äôt offer any help.

Final Thoughts:
The place itself has potential. It‚Äôs clean, the space is fun, and the kids had a good time. But the lack of organization, no announcements, no support, and outdated check-in system made the experience way more stressful than it needed to be. If you‚Äôre booking here, come prepared with your own helpers and make sure to confirm every detail ahead of time.

I‚Äôm not writing this to bash the place ‚Äî just sharing my honest experience so other parents know what to expect, and hopefully so the team can make improvements. A few small changes could make a big difference.

Reviewer: Marilia Mesquita Botelho
Rating: 4/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I visited Play Abby Langley for the first time on February 22, 2025, with my four kids. We arrived at 9:30 AM to avoid peak hours.

Overall, it's a great place for kids. In the morning, it was clean and well-maintained. However, by noon, it got significantly busier. There was a mix of people‚Äîsome who had been there since the morning without shoes (as required), and new arrivals in the afternoon still wearing shoes. This led to a lot of mess.

The washrooms didn‚Äôt have garbage cans near the toilets, so unfortunately, some parents started leaving dirty diapers around. The staff worked hard, constantly cleaning both the playground floor and equipment, but they struggled to keep up with the growing crowd.

By 2 PM, the place was packed. I saw a child bleeding, parents arguing with staff, and long lineups both to enter and exit. It felt chaotic.

In the end, Play Abby Langley is like many other indoor playgrounds. Since it's new, it looks nice, but the experience can change drastically depending on the crowd.

Review: Was super excited to have a Play Abby in Langley I booked my daughters party there. I paid for the whole place for 2 hrs to be told I won't get to use the whole place. I asked before hand about decorating and set up as I see they had 3 tiny little "rooms" downstairs for parties. I asked about upstairs, to just be told "Oh it's much easier if you do it downstairs so you don't have to do go up and down the stairs." Come party day I was told I don't get the whole venue. I asked why couldnt i use upstairs and all they would tell me is "its not part of your package." When i literally paid for thr whole venue. I had almost 40 kids plus parents. It only made sense to set up upstairs with decorations and food but nope. They gave me 2 tiny tables that would've have barely fit 10 kids. Then I had to put my food in one of the tiny rooms downstairs, presents tossed into the other and told them to give me enough tables to fit all the kids. The tables were set up right in front of the slides making it all cramped. Basically no flat walls to put up decorations. I was not happy. Paid over $500 for the whole venue but I didn't get to use the whole venue. False advertisement!

Reviewer: Sydney Gorden
Rating: 4/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Came here today for the first time and my daughter (19 months) had a amazing time!
The young child area, I believe, is better then the original Play Abby location as there is more things to do for crawling children while still having areas for those who need more challenge but aren't ready for the big area.
Everything was very clean, and when speaking to others who have been here before found this was to be expected which I love. I don't think I ever looked around and didn't see staff cleaning something.
For the entry fee this place is well worth it.
However there are two criticism I have to put out that takes this place from a 5 stars to 4. The first is that all the unused outlets were uncovered. I 100% agree that children should be supervised here at all times however it only takes a second for tragedy to strike and a pack of outlet covers aren't unreasonably expensive. Open outlets should definitely be covered ASAP.
The second is one myself and other parents found very off putting. The music playing was not appropriate for children. I don't think any child playing here should here the words "Superman that hoe". Someone said they asked the staff if the music could be changed and were told "This is the playlist we play" which I am curious if management knows about. I'm not saying they should play only kids bop and baby shark (good gods please don't). However the music should be void of explicit words and adult subject matter if you're playing it in a childrens indoor playground. If management wants one curated for them feel free to let me know, id be happy to make them one thats child appropriate that won't make the adults want to do their own head in.
Overall this place is wonderful and if those two things are tended too ill gladly update my review to 5 stars later.

Reviewer: Anita McNicol
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Went to try out the new Play Abby Langley after school yesterday. I was very impressed with the space, ambiance and vibes. I love play Abby Abbotsford and play Abby Langley definitely has some similarities but so fun differences too.
The structure was easy for me, even as an older, larger person to navigate with my kiddos.  It was not hard on my feet, back or knees as I got to stand up through most of the play area.
They have a little sports court that allowed for some fun play and was a favorite for my kids. The slides were smooth.
The bathrooms were very clean and the accessible bathroom was especially impressive. So I know that Grandma will be in good shape if she met us there.
My absolute favorite thing about play! Abby Langley and Abbotsford is that you can bring in your own food and drinks. This meant that we from end of school until closing + we were able to eat snacks + partial dinner there while they played.
They have separate play spaces for older kids and for  toddlers.
Overall, this will be our go-to spot for meeting with friends and family for playdates in this area. They have loyalty cards with discounted admissions which makes going even more affordable.
Looking forward to going back.

Reviewer: Kate Holt
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: As a toddler mom I highly recommend the new Langley Play Abby.

The first thing I noticed was that the staff was constantly cleaning which was nice to see.

The toddler area was beautifully done and large. But even in the bigger kid area I didn't find I had to help her too much which was nice. So many play places I spend the entire time lifting her or trying to avoid the sudden floor cut outs.

Prewarning the top level is very warm and you're not able to stand. Wear a thin shirt. I was iffy if I'd be able to get thru the rollers. Some areas were tight but I was able to squeeze thru and I'm not a tiny person haha

We got the loyalty card which is $63 but gets her age (1.5) 10 times or it's $9 if you want to pay per visit. Being a stay home Mom on a budget I really appreciate this as I can take her there pretty much 4 times for free.

Bathrooms are spotless with a change table. Most of not all the ride on toys took cards. Plus some toy and candy machines that took coins.

They sell snacks, ice cream, plushies and bottled drinks - I didn't purchase so don't know the price but love the options. Lots of high chairs.

We will be a regular for sure

Review: I hosted a birthday party for my daughter at this facility. It is a really nice centre , clean and lots of interactive things for kids to do especially the water table - it was a hit! I was disappointed with how the business was managed. I picked a time slot (4-6) that was the last birthday of the day. Paid for the extra 30 minutes as 2 hours for set up/ clean up , play time and entertainment is quite limited. I also booked a princess character from 530-630pm which is til the very end of the party. I contacted the manager to express my concern with timing and if we could just have some extra time after 630pm to clear out the space and get people out. From the sounds of it the manager was okay with it as long as no one was using the downstairs play centre part after 630pm. Which no one was. As soon as it hit 630pm we were approached by staff to collect payment for overtime of $75. We were trying to pack up and get people out and then was approached with that ‚Ä¶it was super off putting. I explained to the staff that I spoke to the manager on the phone the morning of the party and I explained it will take us time to clear out with the amount of stuff we had for the party but no one would actually be using the play centre downstairs after 630pm. Unfortunately how the business was managed was not very professional and seemed very much about money not the experience. The cost to rent the space for 2 hours is already highly priced. I would not host another birthday at this facility again or recommend it after the negative experience with the staff.

Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. Reviewer: adamjmaxon
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This place was ok, I guess. The employees we interacted with were pleasant. No issue there. I personally didn't care for the separate rooms. I like an open room that I don't have to be up my child's shadow when it comes to an indoor play place. After that, the snack and drink area is open and accessible to the children. My kid wanted to open the drawers and I saw another getting into the little fridge they had. Beyond that, they have a room filled with beads (maybe dried chickpeas?). The room is segregated by a thick vinyl curtain like a car wash, but the beads still get out into the rest of the play area despite the best efforts of the staff to keep them in that area. So it ended up being a lot of following around looking out for hazards. I didn't have fun. The toys and structures were decent enough. I doubt I will be back to be honest. As a side note, I understand you can get alcohol everywhere 'round these parts but it seems odd to have it at a  child's play place. Especially when the children have access to the child size tables these drinks are placed on. Yeah. Definitely not coming back.

Reviewer: Rachel Mikkola
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited 4 months ago
Review: My family has been going to this place since it opened. This has always been a fun place until recently.  My 10 yo daughter and seven year old autistic son came to me upset and visibly shaken, when I asked what was wrong they said the worker yelled at them to get off a jumping item, I asked my kids why and they had no idea. So when I went to ask the worker she states my kids were not following the rules and stated she told them the rules. I looked at my kids and knew they had no clue. I then asked the worker to please explain the rules to me with my kids there so I knew the rules as well as my kids. ( most mothers do this so when later when  I can remind them before playing.)  instead she just repeated I already told them, over and over. I asked I want to know the rules so I can explain them to my son again later. She refused to and just argued. We decided to leave and will not be back. We will travel to Vancouver or Olympia for our jump houses. Sad the owners were so friendly and staff up until this last year. Keisha the worker needs to learn patience and grace when dealing with children. After a long talk with my kids they said she never said anything to them about rules only yelled at them to get off. Again thank you Keisha for giving my children a negative experience at one of their favorite places.

Response to owners comment

I asked what the rules were of the bounce house in question. Not at any moment did any of the three workers show me the posted rules or that they are online after being asked multiple times. I did not sign a waiver so I was not aware. As a mother that use to go frequently, I walked with my kids and supervised them. The younger girls that worked there before walked around were constantly cleaning the mats and items. I have never seen any of the current staff do this. Typically the gentleman is seen walking around,  the other two ladies are usually sitting talking or on their phones‚Ä¶the customer service has went down hill. They are the face of your company.

Reviewer: Lauren Quinn
