Review: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely Amazing ‚Äì A Perfect Spot for All Ages!

Play Grounds of LaCrosse is hands-down one of the best indoor play facilities we‚Äôve ever been to! From the moment you walk in, it‚Äôs clear that every detail has been thoughtfully designed with families in mind. There is something here for every age ‚Äî from toddlers exploring soft play zones to older kids climbing, sliding, building, and bouncing their way through creative and engaging areas.

The space is immaculately clean ‚Äî truly spotless ‚Äî which is a huge plus when you have little ones crawling and climbing around. The bathrooms are modern, spacious, and sparkling clean, and the adorable party rooms are perfect for birthday celebrations or group get-togethers.

One of our favorite surprises was the caf√©! It‚Äôs not just your typical snack bar ‚Äî it has a great selection of food and drinks (including coffee for the grown-ups!) and plenty of options to keep kids happy and fueled for more play.

The pricing is also incredibly reasonable, especially considering it‚Äôs all-day play! You can come and go as needed, and I love that it feels very secure ‚Äî only those who have purchased a ticket receive a personalized entry code, which gives so much peace of mind.

Play Grounds of LaCrosse has truly thought of everything. It‚Äôs fun, safe, clean, and welcoming ‚Äî a total gem for families looking to burn off energy and make lasting memories. We‚Äôll definitely be back again and again!

Reviewer: Julie Vang
Rating: 3/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Feedback Regarding Party Room Booking Experience:

I‚Äôm writing to share some feedback regarding our recent experience hosting a party at your facility, which we booked from 6-8PM.

While the children had a wonderful time and we appreciated the timely arrival of the pizzas and the help provided by your on-site staff member, I did want to raise a few concerns that caused some confusion and disappointment.

According to the party room description, the booking includes ‚Äúaccess to the facility for up to 10 kids for a total of three hours.‚Äù I scheduled our party room from 6-8PM (they have allotted time slots for you to select from) with the understanding that the children would have an hour of play after our reserved party room time (8-9PM). However, we were unaware that the facility itself closes at 8PM. This meant that we did not receive the full three hours of access that were advertised.

Are we advised to arrive early to make use of the extra hour of playtime? Additionally, no closing announcement was made to give us a heads-up before the facility shut down. We only became aware of the closing time when I asked to store the birthday cake (ice cream) around 7:45PM, which was also when we were scrambling to locate misplaced car keys while trying to clean up the party room.

While your staff member was kind and understanding in the moment, I left feeling disappointed that we unintentionally missed out on a full hour of what we paid for. A simple courtesy email ahead of time outlining the facility hours, or a reminder to arrive early for playtime, would have gone a long way toward clarifying expectations. As it stands, the experience felt misleading.

I‚Äôm sharing this in the hope that you might consider updating your communication process for future guests. I hope you‚Äôll take this feedback into account for improving the overall experience.

Reviewer: Ava Nagle
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: Honestly quite disappointed. I took my two kiddos (1) and (5) there today. I do think this would be a good place to bring your kids if it was to be actively supervised and not remotely monitored. Leaving it up to parents to watch their own children lead to multiple disturbing instances I saw today. A kid literally laid on top of an infant because her mother was supposed to be watching and didn‚Äôt. For this reason alone I won‚Äôt be returning as often as I had planned! I truly hope they rethink the idea of having it up to the parents. Also the cafe staff is to sanitize on their down time and doesn‚Äôt seem to get down time so I‚Äôm a little concerned about everything only getting sanitized once a day at the end. The 3 and under is supposed to have no shoes but nobody is actively monitoring it so parents are wearing outside shoes where infants are playing. Also comparing it to an outside park is not the equivalent because you are to pick up after your self and clean up. I would never leave a place messy or not try to clean something up but to actively advertise clean it up yourself is sort of off putting. I do think the cafe prices seemed very reasonable however I was overcharged due to their system having different prices and had a long wait to get a refund for the difference. The website also says they have IPads to be able to buy tickets and that was false they have no iPads at the entrance. I do think if they had it being attended and changed the price discrepancy in the system, put iPads out like advertised it would be a lot better. However after today I wouldn‚Äôt be able to go and have peace of mind that a altercation wouldn‚Äôt arise. I also witnessed the owners kiddo running around yelling mom without her nearby that was also a little concerning she wasn‚Äôt watching her own child. Going to edit it to one star for the terrible response from the owner.

Reviewer: Anneliese Wilhelm
Rating: 3/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I love the concept and think the idea is very much needed in the area. I am concerned the current style of operation isn‚Äôt sustainable long term.
-The website clearly explains pricing, rules and how to buy tickets. Despite this it seemed many people either can‚Äôt read or felt entitled to disregard the rules.
- Entry was straightforward (clearly listed in the website)

-Pricing is fair and not having to charge adults for admission is a huge pro and draw to take my child here.

-I was anticipating a much more put together space that flowed and was professionally installed.(the 3 play scapes and ninja course were professional grade) The execution/construction was somewhat underwhelming for a commercial space,  particularly the floor in the ninja area with gaps and lips/taping that made it easy to trip.

-I fear this place will not be sustainable without some staff on site to supervise based on the lack of supervision by many parents. The website and signs clearly state no shoes and everyone must wear socks. Most adults were wearing shoes, but still in all the play areas where children were to be wearing socks. To me this does not make sense. Either everyone should be in socks or everyone should be in shoes.  Although my child had on grippy socks a lot of the equipment is plastic and slippery. The floor on the basketball court is very slick and I witnessed multiple wipe outs.
-There were multiple instances where I witnessed older children rough housing in the 3 and under area which made it unsafe for the toddlers. Examples include climbing on the plastic tree house roof, hanging on the chimney almost ripping it off and jumping off the roof, the door was also ripped off the hinges.
The car/bike area is cool but those toys were getting so abused by children outside the posted age rage slamming them into each other, exceeding size and weight limits and no parents redirecting to be found.
I hope the owners rethink having supervised hours or time blocks to make the experience more enjoyable and safe for all ages and not have all their equipment destroyed in the first week of being open.
I recognize that the responsibility should be on the individual parents to respect the rules in place to keep this a nice and safe space for all to enjoy, but based on what I witnessed today people can‚Äôt be left to their own devices.
I hope with a few small improvements and individual people being more respectful of the shared space this business becomes a staple in LaCrosse to be enjoyed by all.

-----------------------

I saw 7 year olds in the toddler area climbing and standing on the roof of the plastic treehouse with younger children under him. Again, no adult to be seen. The wear and tear on this place is already evident with some doors coming off.
I think this could be a fun place for kids, but I feel that the owners need to spring for paid supervision to keep the equipment and space in good condition and help keep people safe. It should not be a free-for-all. Maybe there should be set playtimes for certain ages.  I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôd bring a toddler back.

Reviewer: T M
Rating: 5/5

Review: Compact FREE indoor playground for toddlers to Kindergarten children. Just need to scan ID at the front. No age limit although parent supervision is required all the time.

Playground equipment, kitchen toy, kids tables, book & carpet area, big blocks and 2 bouncy houses. Table and chairs along the wall for easy supervision.
No food or beverage allowed in the playroom.

You can rent a room in front of the playroom for a birthday party etc. $50/h, minimum 2 hours. The playroom remains open to everybody even if you rent the room for a party.

At 2024 Jan bowling alley is not in operation.

Reviewer: Rachel Mikkola
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited 4 months ago
Review: My family has been going to this place since it opened. This has always been a fun place until recently.  My 10 yo daughter and seven year old autistic son came to me upset and visibly shaken, when I asked what was wrong they said the worker yelled at them to get off a jumping item, I asked my kids why and they had no idea. So when I went to ask the worker she states my kids were not following the rules and stated she told them the rules. I looked at my kids and knew they had no clue. I then asked the worker to please explain the rules to me with my kids there so I knew the rules as well as my kids. ( most mothers do this so when later when  I can remind them before playing.)  instead she just repeated I already told them, over and over. I asked I want to know the rules so I can explain them to my son again later. She refused to and just argued. We decided to leave and will not be back. We will travel to Vancouver or Olympia for our jump houses. Sad the owners were so friendly and staff up until this last year. Keisha the worker needs to learn patience and grace when dealing with children. After a long talk with my kids they said she never said anything to them about rules only yelled at them to get off. Again thank you Keisha for giving my children a negative experience at one of their favorite places.

Response to owners comment

I asked what the rules were of the bounce house in question. Not at any moment did any of the three workers show me the posted rules or that they are online after being asked multiple times. I did not sign a waiver so I was not aware. As a mother that use to go frequently, I walked with my kids and supervised them. The younger girls that worked there before walked around were constantly cleaning the mats and items. I have never seen any of the current staff do this. Typically the gentleman is seen walking around,  the other two ladies are usually sitting talking or on their phones‚Ä¶the customer service has went down hill. They are the face of your company.

Reviewer: Maxwell Rounds
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: We had a planned party and learned something from the experience: We arrived early to set up and had to wait until after our alloted time to be allowed to enter the den. We had been told we were allowed 15 minutes to set up. We were late getting out as we had thought we were still allowed the 60 minutes. It resulted in just over $54.00 in charges. Ill save you some money on your party - do it elsewhere and just bring the kids in to play - you dont get the 60 minutes you pay over $200 for. Just some free advertising.

*Edit following owner response: Now I know why we got the car seat delivered to our party that belonged to the next one and had to deal with her complaints about us taking her stuff. I wish I could say that we were mad about what you believe we were. As local business owners ourselves - it wasnt on our radar until we were still sitting at the octagonal table after our party started. Cameras have time stamps. I acknowledged that we were in fact late departing, but your staff was unloading the following party after we had departed.

Reviewer: Nathan Pierce
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Scotty‚Äôs Playground is ‚Äúthe tallest indoor play structure in the Northwest.‚Äù It is named after Scott Banke who died of bone cancer in 2002 at 12 years old. Although it is at a Christian church, they welcome everyone for FREE! There is a HUGE multi-level play structure with climbing obstacles, crawling tubes, a cargo net bridge, tube slides, lookout observation windows, and more! The playground is cleverly decorated with douglas fir trees, a sun, and a 3-story tall mural! The large play structure is for ages 3-11. Another small structure and foam pads are for infants to 3 years. They also have foosball and air hockey tables. They even sell snacks! The bathroom is clean and there are step stools for the toilet and water fountains. Parents are not allowed on the play structure, but there are tables to sit and watch or visit with others. Shoes are not allowed and socks are required in most of the floor, so there‚Äôs cubby holes to store them. It‚Äôs all FREE and it looks like they have a donation box in case you want to help contribute to the maintenance and whatnot. I think it‚Äôs all volunteers who tend to the playground, so be nice and show your appreciation.

If you choose to give a thumbs-up üëçüèΩ or not, I hope you found my review helpful!

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

-----------------------

Reviewer: I P
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. You‚Äôll leave happier than a kitten with a ball of yarn.

Review: As a restaurant owner, I am not typically one to leave bad reviews‚Äîbut I absolutely have to address something that happened today. I purchased a $16 cheese and fruit plate that was full of old/bruised fruit. I kindly asked if they could remake the plate because my children have sensory issues and wouldn‚Äôt eat the fruit. When they remade it, they gave us less than HALF the food that was on the original plate. When I asked them where the rest of the cheese was, they said ‚Äúthe cheese assortment is at random, that‚Äôs just how we do it.‚Äù It was insanely busy and I didn‚Äôt want to cause any delays for other families, but I am SO disappointed. They served me slivers of apple peels on the second plate, FOUR crackers, and a small pile of Swiss cheese that my children obviously wouldn‚Äôt eat. I feel like they did this deliberately, as the employees looked annoyed I even brought the plate to their attention. For $16, food should be fresh and stored properly to avoid bruising and spoiling. They would not give me a refund. Though my kids love this place, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be visiting again because of the blatant disrespect. I spend hundreds of dollars here a month, so I expected a little more kindness and care. Reviewer: Ashley Bradley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

-----------------------

Reviewer: I P
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you feel welcome, lets the kids burn off some energy, and gives parents a little breather. If y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt been yet, go check it out. You‚Äôll leave happier than a kitten with a ball of yarn.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Corrina Slicher
Rating: 5/5

Review: Wow, what an amazing place for a party! So glad that my daughter requested City Play for her 5th birthday party. I loved that we had the entire space to ourselves for the party. Parents all got to socialize while kids played and there were no concerns over trying to keep track of where they kids were. Everyone had a great time and the party was relaxed, not chaotic like a large indoor playground type of place.
City Play is spotlessly clean and decorated to the finest detail with adorable and real life items that inspire kids‚Äô imaginative play. It‚Äôs my child‚Äôs favorite place to play.
Best of all, our hosts from City Play (Braelyn and Hope), were incredible. They took care of all the details small and large. They helped with timing, took care of setting up and cleaning up, and even helped to hand out cupcakes and pack up our items at the end. They made sure each detail was handled and the party felt truly effortless. I would absolutely recommend anyone to have their child‚Äôs party here, it is worth it. You will be well taken care of!

Reviewer: Cameron Tow
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Phenomenal birthday party for my daughter. Brooke and Braelyn went so far above and beyond to make everything run smoothly I was blown away. I had multiple parents comment to me about how well planned and run the party seemed to be, and I had to tell them it wasn't me - the two women working there deserved all the credit. Not only did they physically assist with all the moving parts (set up, clean up, kid herding, etc.), but they also had wonderful ideas without being pushy about anything. They even had a candle for us, the one thing we forgot.

The facilities themselves are extremely clean and well maintained, and the kids had a lot of fun. I was also really happy that the company doesn't scrape off the top of the tips left for the workers (I specifically asked). These workers work really hard and deserve to be taken care of by their employer, so points to City Play for not siphoning from their tips.

Thanks again Brooke and Braelyn, you two were so sweet and helpful and I'm sure you'll be seeing plenty of those parents again for their kids' parties!

Review: Very fun for my four year old, she never got bored. Everything was cleaned, I couldn‚Äôt believe how hardworking all the staff are, they are really on top of things. One complaint is that the floor is extremely slippery. They require nonslip socks but even then, kids fall all the time. My daughter wasn‚Äôt even running and slipped and fell and cut her neck on the little bridge. She got really, really hurt. They were nice and made sure she was okay but I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be back any time soon. Her neck is swollen and has a huge cut. Poor thing. I wish they‚Äôd get a better flooring. Reviewer: Layne Upham
Rating: 5/5

Review: We live in Milwaukie and discovered this place when our babysitter brought our toddler here on a day out a couple weeks ago, and it was the perfect spot to meet up yesterday with a friend who lives on that side of the river.

Everyone on staff is really friendly and engaged with the parents and toddlers. We had an especially great experience with Jas/Jazz (not sure how to spell her name, sorry!) who is truly excellent at her job. They are constantly walking around and reorganizing and cleaning up toys so all the stations are ready for play.

The play space is incredible! Every station is spotlessly clean, beautiful and perfectly themed with miniature versions of a cafe, home, firehouse, vet, market, farmyard, and gas station! There‚Äôs a school bus the kiddos can climb in, a play structure with a fast and fun slide, sensory stations and activity tables. The kiddos in our group especially loved the fan system that makes the play silks fly and the market where they got to fill carts with miniature grocery items and check them out at the register.

There‚Äôs no outside food allowed to accommodate for allergies but they do have snacks available for purchase, though I didn‚Äôt check prices. Admission is really reasonable for an hour and a half playtime. The bathroom is wonderfully family friendly with a toddler toilet seat, toddler seat with straps, and footstool at the sink, and it‚Äôs even stocked with diapers, wipes, and feminine supplies that you‚Äôre welcome to use which I thought was a really nice touch.

My one and only criticism is very minor - that the employee room/stock room have a door or baby gate in place of the current curtain. My toddler ran in there a few times and I had to chase him out. Beyond that it was an absolutely perfect experience and we‚Äôve already decided with our friend that we‚Äôll be bringing our kiddos every couple of weeks to enjoy the space.

Those being said, there are many different variety of things for kids to play with and it is a pretty great place.

Review: I had a very disappointing experience at Oh My Land Club in Coquitlam. I have been to this place a couple of times before and always had a great experience ‚Äî until yesterday .

While my child was playing in the art room sandbox, he accidentally spilled some sand on the floor. A staff member, who was present, reacted angrily and started scolding us harshly. I apologized several times and even cleaned the floor myself using their vacuum, but she continued to nag and speak in an unkind, confrontational manner for several minutes.

What shocked me the most was her behavior toward the children ‚Äî she threw slime down on the table where the kids were playing and said, ‚ÄúIf you cannot follow the rules of this room, get out!‚Äù She also took a small toy airplane away from my child, saying it didn‚Äôt belong in that area. This kind of attitude is completely inappropriate in a children‚Äôs environment.

I tried to remain calm and reported the incident to the club manager, but unfortunately, he showed no interest in resolving the situation fairly or professionally.

As a monthly member, I‚Äôm extremely disappointed and have decided to cancel my membership. I do not recommend this club ‚Äî the staff are not friendly or patient with children, and the atmosphere does not feel supportive or respectful.

Review: As a parent, I was amazed by the staff at this center.
You remember American movies about brave firefighters rushing to a call or rescuers on the beach? How they save precious seconds, their amazingly economical professional movements? The teamwork?
And I watched all this with wide eyes here, in the play center, when I reported that one kid had thrown up.
One announcement and a second later, brave employees rush to the scene of the disaster, armed to the teeth with rags, a washing vacuum cleaner and fencing triangles.
5 minutes!
Exactly 5 minutes later, the rough soft carpet was perfect and returned to work.
It took a long time for my jaw, which had dropped in shock, to fall into place from this beauty of professionalism.

Reviewer: Julia Pomerinskas
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: I attended a birthday party at Oh My Land and had a very disappointing experience. I brought my two daughters, one of whom has a life-threatening disability that causes low muscle tone, requiring the use of a wheelchair. Since she‚Äôs too young for a wheelchair, we use a stroller to accommodate her needs.

Upon arrival, the receptionist refused to allow the stroller into the facility, citing their "policy." I explained that bringing my daughter in without the stroller would be dangerous, as I would have to carry her along with her medications and supervise my other child alone. Despite this, the receptionist was dismissive and showed no empathy or willingness to accommodate.

Even when the party host tried to intervene on my behalf, the receptionist remained indifferent and refused to make any exceptions. This lack of understanding and accommodation for people with disabilities created an unsafe and discriminatory experience for my family.

I hope the management revisits their policies to ensure they are inclusive and accessible to everyone, especially families with children who have disabilities.

Review: We booked a party room 2pm -4pm, in the clever fox room. Facility was great and play area was a lot of fun for the kids. However I was not pleased with the customer service we received. 3 days before our booked date I received an email requesting we change our start time of the party to 30 min earlier than agreed. I explained this is too late notice, and was told ‚Äúokay we will figure something out‚Äù On the party day, we had 3 employees come remind us back to back that our time ends in our room soon. This was between 3:30 and 3:50pm, before our party ended at 4..  It made me as host feel uncomfortable to have my guests feel so rushed, especially since we were told we could host our party from 2-4, with 4-4:15 pm being our cleanup time.

I did not appreciate being rushed to start our cleanup time before the party even ended. This apparently was their idea of ‚Äúfiguring out a solution‚Äù to them double booking themselves.. rushing their guests out the door.. With the prices they are charging for just 2 hours the least they can do is allow guests to have a comfortable time in the room for their allotted two hours.

Based on this, I would not recommend this place for future parties.

Reviewer: Thomas Harris
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited PlayCafe with my two young children, and I have to say, it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. Owners Matt and Michelle have truly created a haven that perfectly caters to both children and their parents.

From the moment we walked in, it was clear that Matt and Michelle understand the unique needs of young families. The play area is incredibly well-designed, with a variety of safe, engaging activities that kept my kids entertained for hours. Every corner of the space is thoughtfully arranged to spark imagination and encourage active play, from the colorful climbing structures to the creative play stations.

What truly sets PlayCafe apart, though, is how well they accommodate parents. The seating area is comfortable and strategically placed so that you can keep an eye on your little ones while enjoying a well-deserved break. The caf√© offers a great selection of refreshments, from freshly brewed coffee to healthy snacks, making it easy to relax and refuel.

Moreover, the entire facility is impeccably clean and well-maintained, which is a testament to the care and dedication Matt and Michelle put into their business. They are always on hand to greet you with a warm smile and are genuinely invested in ensuring that every family has a positive experience.

In a world where finding a place that both children and parents can enjoy equally is rare, PlayCafe stands out as a true gem. It's clear that Matt and Michelle have poured their hearts into creating a space that understands and meets the needs of families. I highly recommend PlayCafe to anyone looking for an all-around great place for kids to play and parents to relax. We will definitely be returning soon!

Reviewer: Eric Bombardier
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: We‚Äôve been to Jungle Jac‚Äôs many times over the years for birthday parties and the attention the workers give is incredible. The place is very clean for a kids play center, it is well organized and everything is taken care of when you have a birthday party. It‚Äôs not super expensive and it‚Äôs worth every dollar, here‚Äôs why:

Kai at the front desk is incredibly patient and helpful. Hanna, in our party room was exceptionally nice, hard working and helpful. She kept on coming over to ask if we needed anything. Who does that anymore? These employees represent the centre extremely well, as well as every other employees that we came across from paying the bill to spending those hard earned tickets or people cleaning the tables and keeping the place nice and clean.

As a parent, it‚Äôs very nice to be able to have everything taken care of for our party and not have to worry about anything like setup, cleanup, food and when to bring the cake. Kids have no idea how stressful it can get, but not here.

In the past years, service has declined everywhere and it‚Äôs very refreshing to see that places like Jungle Jac‚Äôs are able to keep a family business feel to their business.

Out of the 10 times we‚Äôve been there as partygoers and party hosts, it‚Äôs been nothing but consistant and incredible service.

Rating: 1/5

Review: Came here for a birthday party with my son. Everything was good, my son had an amazing time. The venue is perfect for small children as it's very protected. It was our first time here, but we have been wanting to come for some time now, just always hesitated because the price was on the higher end.

The one thing that disappointed us was the attitude of the lady working there. She was not friendly at all, didn't even smile once during the 3 hours that we were there. There is zero customer service. When it came time to leave instead of giving us a 30 min reminder to usher the kids out, she went in at 6pm and shouted at everyone.

I think this is very unnecessary as the kids were having fun. As parents we were already trying to get the kids out of the play area to the best of our ability, but kids don't necessarily respond well to yelling.

I liked the venue, but won't be coming back. We came here to have fun, and this kind of customer service has definitely left a very negative impression for us.

Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 2 years ago
Review: Final Update:
I emailed the playcentre with the information provided in their response and it seemed that they were willing to look into the situation but they ended up going AWOL on me and never took accountability of double booking us in. Not impressed and we will not be going back.

*Update:
Unfortunately we won't be coming back to this playcentre. Originally, we were okay with the expensive rate of $65 for 1 hour of play because all admissions were advertised as private bookings where there would be no other families. However, this must have changed since the last time I was here as when we arrived today, there was another family here as well. I really don't mind sharing the space with other families as this is the norm with all of the other playcentres, but continuing to charge $65 for an hour no longer makes sense. Also, they need to update the information on their website as it is still advertised as private admission bookings.

I wish there was a cheaper option for those who have just one child but my little one had a blast. Place is clean and has a variety of things to play with. We particularly like the ballpit, the slides, and the kitchen play area. I think one hour is plenty of time for little ones to explore the whole place. Will definitely come back.

{Reviewer: Scarlett Hernandez
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We had our daughters birthday party here. The staff were so kind and dimmed the lights and played calming music since our daughter is on the spectrum. Her whole class came and it was great because all the things for the kids to do. I loved that there‚Äôs also a separate room for the party. They helped decorate and tear down. Definitely recommend this place!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Abigail Buckley
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Overall we had a positive experience letting our kids play at Junebug, but a few things I noticed that seemed different than what I expected. Other than a giant ballpit, there were no other play structures or spaces that seemed to be designed for more active play. There were so many wonderful spaces for imaginative and creative play, which my daughter loved. But I know my son was looking for more opportunities to get his energy out.
They have a small more baby friendly corner, but it is not closed off from the rest of the play space. And the rest of the space has several non-baby friendly toys that present choking hazards.
The creative play spaces are all closed off in mini cubicles. So if you have multiple children, it is impossible to keep eyes on all of them at once, making the small toys an extra choking concern.
If you have older toddlers or young kiddos, this space would be great for you! (The kiddo potty and sink in the restroom were a big hit with our toddlers!)
But I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for mamas with babies or younger toddlers who still put small items in their mouths. And it‚Äôs not ideal when looking for a place to let your kids run and play to get their energy out.

reviews:
{Reviewer: Rictorshoue
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My son absolutely loves Ahoy Kitsap Playland, and it's become one of our favorite go-to spots in Kitsap! We visit often, and every time, he has a blast ‚Äî especially with the slides. The whole place is incredibly kid-friendly and safe, which gives me peace of mind as a parent.
The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming. It's clear the staff cares about maintaining a fun and safe environment. One of the best things is that parents can actually sit back and relax while the kids play. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, good visibility of the play areas, and free Wi-Fi ‚Äî a rare and much-appreciated combination for any indoor play space.
Ahoy Kitsap Playland strikes a great balance between active fun for kids and a laid-back vibe for parents. I highly recommend it to any families looking for a safe, fun, and clean place to let their little ones burn off some energy!

Reviewer: Jenna Rempel
Rating: 3/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: It was our first time at Play Jungle today with my two boys (2 and 4 years old). I love the idea, and it is certainly a better fit for our needs than a place like Play Abby. There are some downsides though:

Pros - Quiet and safe! I love that I can see my kids no matter where I am standing (aside from the party area). They have a fantastic selection of toys and the ball pit and slide was a major hit for both of my kids. I was a little concerned about the lack of bathroom, and while packing up both kids to get to the bathroom was a bit of an ordeal, it really wasn‚Äôt that bad.

Cons - the cost. I‚Äôd be more than happy to pay $8, but $12 is pretty steep considering what you get. They‚Äôve definitely done the best they can with the space that they have, but everything is really quite squishy and there isn‚Äôt much space to actually play. For example the train table in top of the wooden structure is only 1x2, so my kids were frustrated they couldn‚Äôt put more than three tracks together before running out of space. The pretend play toys are great, but they are tucked so tight under the wooden structure, the kids can‚Äôt really even do much with them. My boys tried riding the ride on toy and there isn‚Äôt even room to go more than two or three feet without running into something.

The verdict - I was so excited for something like this to come to Abbotsford! And maybe if they ever upgrade locations I‚Äôd be more inclined to come regularity for the $12. Until then, we will definitely be back but it will have to be a special occasion thing due to the cost (I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôd aren‚Äôt the only parents having to prioritize where our money goes these days). I‚Äôm hoping for a punch card or loyalty program to make it more worth our while, but without an active website I‚Äôm not even sure if they have that.

Review: This is an amazing local gem!

The nursing nook was so helpful for moms with infants and the two play areas worked perfectly to separate the big kids so the toddlers had a calmer space.

We had 15 minutes before and after the party for set up and tear down and it was plenty of time.  The staff were so kind and offered lots of help. They cleaned up the play area part way through the party to keep things organized for the kids but also were very courteous and gave us lots of space.

It was a perfect party location and I highly recommend it!
We have also been here for midweek playtimes and loved it. Very clean and well organized. Lots of fun toys and play areas for the kids.

Review: Decent play place with complimentary tea and coffee - I didn't try so can't speak for taste. $10 for an hour was the perfect amount of time for my 1.5 year old . Employee was very friendly and came around and would clean up a few times during the hour. Tables for parents and noticed a high chair for littles.

Compared to our usual visit to Bounce Play Cafe it was a little underwhelming but as still kept my daughter busy.

Daughter was in white pants and left in white so place is clean haha

Would have loved to see a wooden gate keeping the cafe from the play center to keep the kids more contained. Not a huge deal but had to keep bringing my daughter back and away from the shoes.

Being from Langley decent location to meet up with Abbotsford friends and lots of parking.

Downside:
- The blue side is incredibly fast and in my opinion dangerous and very close to the wall. Those kids are flying fast into the wall and it's only a matter of time before a kid breaks a leg. Other parents shared my fear. After once down the slide we didn't return to that pit.

- Change table which was nice and a plus but bathroom off site. Potty training currently (thankfully in pull up diapers) so had to go off schedule. I couldn't imagine if she was freshly out of diapers.

Reviewer: Nick L
Rating: 2/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I would like to inquire about the rules of your indoor playground. I brought my two children to play, and they were having a wonderful time, making friends with all the other children.

While playing and running around, one of my children coughed a couple of times, which is completely understandable as children may cough lightly due to physical exertion. However, I felt deeply offended when two other parents‚Äîwho, in my opinion, were dressed quite inappropriately for a children‚Äôs indoor playground (revealing clothing that I didn‚Äôt find suitable but chose not to comment on, as I prefer avoiding unnecessary conflict)‚Äîreported my child‚Äôs minor cough to your staff.

I explained to your staff that my children are not sick; the cough was simply a natural result of running and playing, and nothing more. Despite this, your staff repeatedly came over to wipe down every toy my children touched, seemingly pressured by these two individuals. This created an uncomfortable and stressful atmosphere for us, as it felt like we were being unfairly singled out.

As a result, we chose to leave after only half an hour, cutting short what should have been an enjoyable visit for my children.

This kind of treatment is simply not appropriate. It left us feeling unwelcome and unfairly judged. I would appreciate a response regarding your policies and how you handle such situations in the future.

Reviewer: Kathrine Irias
Rating: 1/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My sister and I took our kids there on 06/20/25. Our kids are 11 months, 3, 4, 4 and 11. When we first arrived it was fine. The manager checked us in. There wasn‚Äôt very many people there at all. We THOUGHT the staff was pretty friendly at first. My sister took her 11 month old in the infant and toddler section to play in which my 3 year old followed. There wasn‚Äôt very many also two other children in that section much older. Well at that point is when she noticed a male staff member with long hair start watching her and the kids. She started to feel uncomfortable. Our 4 year olds decided to go into the infant and toddler section to play for a moment with the younger kids and that‚Äôs when the staff member told them they needed to get out because they were too big. Never said a word to the much older kids in there or the parent with them. Well all of our kids including my sister got out. None of us were in the area any longer, but for some reason the team never kept watching us and following us around. My sister decided to take her 11 month old back in there for the last 10 minutes we were there and he continued to watch her. My 3 year old came to me at the table and I asked her if she was ready to leave and at the point she walked over to the infant and toddler section to ask my sister if she was ready. Wasn‚Äôt playing, didn‚Äôt touch anything. Had just walked over to ask if she was ready. The team member walked up to my 3 year old and asked her if she was wearing a diaper. My 3 year then responded no. He then responded with okay then you need to leave this area. This is very inappropriate. My daughter is 3. She doesn‚Äôt understand. She wasn‚Äôt doing anything. My sister was right there and he could have talked to the adult instead of ambushing a 3 year old little girl. He should not have been questioning her under garments period! At that point we gathered our stuff. I informed the other staff members of what happened. It‚Äôs very upsetting. I left my number for the manager and have yet to speak with him. I really thought the place was a cool place, my kids loved it, but I really don‚Äôt think we will go back. I don‚Äôt think I will ever recommend this place. I was very creeped out by the situation. I thought it was very inappropriate for an adult to question a child like that. I don‚Äôt ever want my kids to feel uncomfortable.

Reviewer: Brigitte Brodski
Rating: 4/5
Time: a month ago
Review: My 4 and 6 year olds had a great time!  There is also a big separate area for toddlers and crawlers.  It's really big with lots of climbing and sliding and a disco dance room.  It was pretty clean and love that shoes must be off and must wear socks.  The air conditioning worked great and there were lots of table and even outlets on the walls to plug in and lots of tables.  Small thing but love that they give you a paper receipt.  (I keep track of my spending by keeping my receipts and logging them in.)  I love that they are open afternoons/evenings, but wish they opened at 9am.  My kids are at an age they get up at 6am so waiting until 10am for them to open was stressful.
The bathrooms were clean but there are no paper towels or a trash can, and only 1 hand dryer even though there are 2 sinks.  The 3 of us washed our hands then stood around and had to wait for that one hand dryer.  If they are not going to have any paper towels they need one of those foot or elbow openers on the door so you don't have to touch the handle.
It is also a downer that their birthday parties are in the open.  No separate room or temporary room dividers.  There was a birthday party right in the middle of the area with snacks and drinks and pizza and baloons.  My kids wanted to be a part of it and it was a downer telling them they are not invited to the party that's going on right next to them.
The reason I gave only 4 stars is YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO BRING IN FOOD!  I spent $44 and could not even bring our own snacks.  There is no other kids place that does not allow you to bring your own snacks.  They want you to spend even more on their JUNK FOOD.  They say you could leave and come back.  Yeah, after going through the battle to get them out the door you want me to go through the battle to make them leave, pack them in the car, go home or out to eat ($!), then pack them up and come back.  Because of this we will come back but our visits will be few and far between.

Review: My family has been going to this place since it opened. This has always been a fun place until recently.  My 10 yo daughter and seven year old autistic son came to me upset and visibly shaken, when I asked what was wrong they said the worker yelled at them to get off a jumping item, I asked my kids why and they had no idea. So when I went to ask the worker she states my kids were not following the rules and stated she told them the rules. I looked at my kids and knew they had no clue. I then asked the worker to please explain the rules to me with my kids there so I knew the rules as well as my kids. ( most mothers do this so when later when  I can remind them before playing.)  instead she just repeated I already told them, over and over. I asked I want to know the rules so I can explain them to my son again later. She refused to and just argued. We decided to leave and will not be back. We will travel to Vancouver or Olympia for our jump houses. Sad the owners were so friendly and staff up until this last year. Keisha the worker needs to learn patience and grace when dealing with children. After a long talk with my kids they said she never said anything to them about rules only yelled at them to get off. Again thank you Keisha for giving my children a negative experience at one of their favorite places.

Response to owners comment

I asked what the rules were of the bounce house in question. Not at any moment did any of the three workers show me the posted rules or that they are online after being asked multiple times. I did not sign a waiver so I was not aware. As a mother that use to go frequently, I walked with my kids and supervised them. The younger girls that worked there before walked around were constantly cleaning the mats and items. I have never seen any of the current staff do this. Typically the gentleman is seen walking around,  the other two ladies are usually sitting talking or on their phones‚Ä¶the customer service has went down hill. They are the face of your company.

Reviewer: Ashley Bradley

Review: Navigating play places with small kiddos can be daunting‚Ä¶not here! Today was our first time there and I‚Äôm currently 40 weeks + 1 day pregnant with 2 under 4 and they needed to get some wiggles out.

Check-in was seamless and I was immediately put at ease seeing the equipment and how much padding and soft toys there were that were friendly enough for my 1.5 year old to run around with her bigger sister. Everything is in easy eyesight to keep track of multiple kiddos at the same time. I didn‚Äôt feel like I constantly had to rescue them while they were playing because there wasn‚Äôt anything too perilous to try out. It wasn‚Äôt overcrowded with too many kids because you reserve time blocks and they have capacities. The play area is made for kids specifically in the 0-6 age bracket so I wasn‚Äôt worried about a rogue 10 year old smashing into my toddler.

Highly highly recommend for any parents with young kiddos! My two tips would be to make sure you bring grippy socks so there‚Äôs no slipping on the tile (I believe they also sell some there) and if you‚Äôre solo parenting or can‚Äôt bring an adult wingman - caffeinate before you go because drinks are on the outside of the play space and your young kiddos won‚Äôt wanna wait for you to drink your drink to play haha. I was able to get a snack/drink break after about an hour or so which was great, but something I‚Äôll keep in mind for next time if I‚Äôm going alone in the morning.

Thanks to the Bonkerz team for a great experience and a safe space for the youngins to play! Gives me so much less anxiety than most open playground spaces ‚ù§Ô∏è

Review: Well, let me tell ya, as a parent of four lively young‚Äôuns, finding a place like Bonkerz Indoor Play Cafe here in Wenatchee feels like hittin‚Äô the jackpot.

This place is downright brilliant! It‚Äôs like they‚Äôve thought of everything for us parents who just need a moment to sip a hot cup of coffee while the kids are safe and havin‚Äô a ball.

The whole setup is fantastic. The play area is padded, super well-lit, and you can see your kids wherever they are‚Äîno blind spots at all. I watched ‚Äòem clean every nook and cranny while I was there, and let me tell ya, they‚Äôre on top of their game. It‚Äôs clear that safety and cleanliness are top priorities.

What I really love is how much fun the little ones can have. There‚Äôs all kinds of stuff to keep ‚Äòem entertained‚Äîclimbing, pretend play, you name it‚Äîand it‚Äôs all designed for kiddos up to six years old.

Meanwhile, we grown-ups get to sit back in their comfy caf√© area with plenty of seating, enjoy a cup of coffee, and maybe even plug in our phones or laptops if we need to. It‚Äôs perfect!

They‚Äôve got flexible options for families too, like single play passes or monthly memberships if you‚Äôre a regular, plus bundles for those of us with more than one kid who love a good deal.

I just can‚Äôt say enough about how glad I am to have Bonkerz here in town. I asked her to show me what certificate she wanted me to bring in and I‚Äôd happily apply for it and yet she said she had no idea what it was or what it looked like. She didn‚Äôt have any of her facts straight on this matter which resulted in us leaving with unhappy kids. I‚Äôm at least happy this situation happened before we paid. We ended up taking our business to Raindrops Playhouse in Happy Valley and they gladly accepted us. In the end it worked out for us because they charged exactly the same for so much more and much more affordable food. We also appreciate being able bring in our own snacks if we wanted. Now we know where to go to in the future and to AVOID this unfriendly establishment. Picture of my service dog calmly laying down next to me while my kids played and where he continued to politely stay for almost 3hrs.

Reviewer: Darian ‚ÄúAvery‚Äù Miller
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: We took our toddler here for the first time yesterday and I know he enjoyed it. The staff were friendly, accommodating, kind, and understanding when dealing with neurodivergent customers and having to work with the sound of children play-screaming in the background and all around. There was a party going on in one of the party rooms, but you wouldn't have known aside from the staff asking if we were part of the party or if we were separate, or the sign for the door. Any noise was very well managed by the design of the space and/or adults involved.

The play structure was sturdy and age appropriate for the target age range. Toddlers will have a difficult time getting up to the slide due to a ledge that's a bit on the high side, but my husband and I were both able to climb up and hang out in turns to help our toddler get up the final ledge. The rules of the play structure and establishment in general are simple, easy to follow, and reasonable.

My husband and I were surprised at how easy it is to hold a conversation in the eating area. It was incredibly clean and well kept all throughout the establishment. There is nice noise balancing throughout the whole place. We ordered a half Hawaiian half meat 16 inch pizza, a Mediterranean salad, some popcorn chicken for the tot. It was all delicious and had great flavor. My toddler is a picky eater, especially about his chicken nuggets, and he was more than happy to eat their popcorn chicken and said they tasted good. Despite the party also needing food prepared for them, we received our order quite quickly. The staff are very efficient in their kitchen space.

We were there from about 4:30pm-6:30pm on a Friday night. On our way out, we were already discussing returning again sometime. It wasn't terribly chaotic and it wasn't too quiet. It was honestly just right. Keep it up, Wildlings!

Reviewer: Lauren Simon
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Beautiful, immaculate indoor play space. Bigger than wiggle room, with more visibility than PDX Play date. The owner is a mom and has thought of everything here. The play equipment is clean, well-maintained, and fun. Other places are dirty, broken down, and run by disinterested teens - so this is a delightful place. It‚Äôs like everything I want in a playground very close to Portland. $16 per kid over 2. Open 9am-7am on Saturday!! No random two-hour window etc. Reasonably priced birthday parties.

Good value and providing what families want without a zillion up charges. Forgot socks? Can buy a pair for $1.50 at wholesale cost.

Rules are clear, visibility is good, so this is a great place especially for ages 2-8. Babies are welcome and kids under 2 are free with a sibling. My baby crawled around on the floor and that was fine. Picked her up with it was prime time for three year olds to rampage through here (as they should!!). Then it quieted down and we could play some more.

There‚Äôs a nice little corner for some wall-mounted items. Soft support block against the wall for babes learning to stand.

Bigger kids could have fun here too. Everything is reasonably priced, friendly and attentive owner who is open to feedback and tweaking everything until it reaches as close to perfect as a place with kids can be. We were there during a birthday party and it was great, not too crowded. The coffee is really good, kids food is simple crowd-pleasers, and there is beer/wine for grown ups if they want it. But everyone was still watching their kids and intervening as necessary. Parking is plentiful. Area is well-kept and feels new. Bathrooms are spotless. Tables are wiped and sanitized between uses. Crumbs swept up. A fast-filling water fountain with cups right next to it so no nasty water fountain.

Baked goods are fresh and tasty. Beautiful murals on the walls. Wall outlets accessible from every table. Fire extinguisher readily accessible. A kiddo had a scraped knee outside and they staff got out a big first aid kit and helped them get patched up.

Some of the steps getting up were a little big for 2-3 year olds, but that may have been by design so they don‚Äôt climb parts that might be difficult for them. It seems like it took some time but they ma aged to get up eventually.

Absolutely worth the drive. In an era when places try to give you less and charge you more, this place delivers excellent value in a beautiful location. Let‚Äôs help keep it nice and pristine for a fellow mom and small business owner. Best one in the area!!

Reviewer: Thomas Harris
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited PlayCafe with my two young children, and I have to say, it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. Owners Matt and Michelle have truly created a haven that perfectly caters to both children and their parents.

From the moment we walked in, it was clear that Matt and Michelle understand the unique needs of young families. The play area is incredibly well-designed, with a variety of safe, engaging activities that kept my kids entertained for hours. Every corner of the space is thoughtfully arranged to spark imagination and encourage active play, from the colorful climbing structures to the creative play stations.

What truly sets PlayCafe apart, though, is how well they accommodate parents. The seating area is comfortable and strategically placed so that you can keep an eye on your little ones while enjoying a well-deserved break. The caf√© offers a great selection of refreshments, from freshly brewed coffee to healthy snacks, making it easy to relax and refuel.

Moreover, the entire facility is impeccably clean and well-maintained, which is a testament to the care and dedication Matt and Michelle put into their business. They are always on hand to greet you with a warm smile and are genuinely invested in ensuring that every family has a positive experience.

In a world where finding a place that both children and parents can enjoy equally is rare, PlayCafe stands out as a true gem. It's clear that Matt and Michelle have poured their hearts into creating a space that understands and meets the needs of families. I highly recommend PlayCafe to anyone looking for an all-around great place for kids to play and parents to relax. We will definitely be returning soon!

Also, they are testing out staying open until 8pm on Friday nights. We popped back in with dad in the evening for a local beer and some more play time, did not disappoint!

As for the cleanliness it deserves a 12/10!! The place is absolutely spotless, tables always cleaned efficiently and the toilets are always lovely and clean. Reviewer: Brittany Mashburn
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: As a mom of two little girls ages 3 & 4, I know how impossible it is to find a clean & ‚Äúyoung kid‚Äù friendly place where my girls can go play without me having to follow them around like a helicopter to make sure they are safe. The high top tables at Little Pandas lets me keep an eye on them while still enjoying a tasty drink. They entertain themselves and always find another kiddo to play with.

Now for the more important part of this review; I have read through some of these other reviews and I am shocked at what I have read!

-The owners (husband and wife) both introduced themselves to us when we first checked this spot out and we have had multiple great interactions with them since! They are a huge reason I decided to grab the membership because I truly feel that this is a safe environment for my girls and I.
Even my daughters love looking for them when we arrive.

-the owners should NOT be policing your children! Watch your kids, make sure they are playing nicely and if they are stealing toys from kids or running and being wild, HANDLE THAT YOURSELF! This is not a daycare!

-If anyone going to this place has children, you know how hard it is to keep a play room clean and organized when there are multiple kids running around and dumping toys out. How many of your kids actually put things back where they found it at this age?! I have seen their employees walk the play area cleaning and organizing which I think is great. But then 3 seconds later, I see kids dumping toys back out.

-I am a business owner myself and can appreciate that this couple is trying to provide for their kids and still get work done while their NEWBORN baby sleeps in the stroller right next to them. They don‚Äôt need to talk with you or focus all on you. Enjoy their space and let them be business owners/ parents!

-If you hate crowds or going when it‚Äôs busy, then don‚Äôt go during their peak hours! It‚Äôs as simple as that. Same thing with going to the Everett‚Äôs children museum! Don‚Äôt go to a kid place on a weekend and then be shocked that it is busy. You learn what times are the busiest or most crowded and you avoid it. The building is only so big! Use common sense. They literally offer cheaper play during their slower day and times.

-They even go above and beyond to provide FREE diapers and wipes in their bathrooms because they are also parents and know that sometimes we forget and need those extras! Those small touches in my eyes are amazing.

-this isn‚Äôt a restaurant! They offer the usual toddler snacks and some tasty pastries plus fun drinks. Bring your own snacks if this isn‚Äôt enough for you. Or hit one of the many restaurants located on the same street.

- People will always find something to complain about or use hurtful statements when they are jealous of something. This family created a  beautiful place that most moms are just wishing to find when they need a minute without having their kids climb all over them and their kids can go burn off energy while interacting nicely with other kids. This is that place üêºüñ§

Reviewer: Dayna Sakanashi
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My catchphrase is: Google doesn't lie! Most review apps/sites (looking at you, Yelp) are rife with ridiculous reviewers complaining about unrealistic or down right insulting criticisms...

But the parents at this cafe have given mostly stellar reviews and I agree - it's organized, has a clean bathroom very close by, the cafe has tasty chicken empanadas and other goodies, plenty of seating, and a wonderful play area for kids mostly 3 and under. I brought my toddler and he LOVED it here.

It's nice that there's a variety of play: toys, make believe structures, a playground structure, and area for infants.

There's tons of moms and parents that fill up the place. That's something the cafe can't control other than the max occupancy but honestly it's a good sign that it's so popular. It can get crowded and a bit loud, but for a weekday morning the kids can still run around and I thought it was honestly not bad noise level wise.

It's very affordable. I've been to many places that you need to either pay hourly or for an unlimited day pass but it's usually kind of dirty. Here, they have an affordable price (check their site) and we ended up staying for almost 3 hours! Now that's a deal.

When we sat down for lunch, my kid looked out the big windows and kept pointing at the cars/vehicles passing down the road! It was the reason why we ended up buying a 5-Day pass!

The part that made me appreciate this cafe was the customer service. Two ladies at the front were amazing and always so welcoming - they communicated everything about our order from how long it would take to even offering to reheat it (my toddler needed a diaper change). We can't wait to come back!

PS: There's a Goodwill across the parking lot so that's a bonus. More reasons to stop by here.

Reviewer: Rachel
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Recently had my daughters 6th birthday here. The facility was extremely hot and one of my partygoers ended up with an extreme heat rash and had to leave early. Every child was extremely red and overheated. The staff was rude and did not check on our party at all, outside of dropping off the food that we had to wait forever for. One staff member brought fries on accident, then came back and took them from the kids even though she informed us they were now going to be thrown away. I asked to leave them since they were getting tossed, and she said ‚Äúsorry, I can‚Äôt, my boss is here‚Äù and left. Nobody brought us plates or a cake knife. We had to track somebody down each time and the cake knife was filthy.

Booking the party was a nightmare. Online says Fancy is on sale at 299. Online booking wouldn‚Äôt show the sale price so I called instead. First staff member told me it was not the Fancy party that was discounted but then apologized after viewing the website and realized they were wrong. They transferred me to a manager to book since the front was busy but the manager was short with me and rudely told me the sale price was ‚Äúsold out‚Äù. She did not ask me any questions about the potential party. I booked online anyways and then inquired about it again at check out after the party. The staff member checking us out told me the sale price was available any day besides Saturday. Had I known that, I would have booked the party for a Sunday to get the almost $100 dollar discount. Why did the manager not explain this to me during that initial phone call? Why tell me it was sold out? Why not ask me which day I planned to have the party? The manager, Griselda, was unapproachable and rude over the phone during that initial phone call as well as during the party.

The owner was there and finally came out to talk to me. However, they lied and told me she wasn‚Äôt the owner and that the owner lives out of state. A quick internet search showed me she was the owner‚Ä¶it was very odd that they didn‚Äôt tell me the truth? She clearly did not care to rectify anything. She didn‚Äôt speak English so a staff member spoke to her for me about the situation. All she offered me was 40 dollars (gift card) for my next visit even though I paid close to 600 after everything. I wish I realized who she was while I was there still. Although it‚Äôs such a weird situation to pretend you‚Äôre not the owner!

The lack of professionalism, the terrible customer service, the lying, the heat that no one was willing to fix, the lack of accountability‚Ä¶the whole experience was so unforgivable. I‚Äôm so disappointed.

EDIT to respond to reply:
You guys had one other party going on while we were there. Every single person in there that day knew how hot it was. We heard numerous people complain outside our party and could visibly see most of the patrons sweating.
As for the booking, I called because I wasn‚Äôt going to sit and enter in different dates. I should be able to call and expect honesty, information, and great customer service. Your employees gave me three separate and conflicting responses and Griselda was terribly rude. You reviewing your software system means nothing and is not related to the situation. I was able to book, the discount wasn‚Äôt applying. I should have been told why and not that it ‚Äúsold out‚Äù which wasn‚Äôt true.

I left that day defeated. Only reason I was somewhat calm and nice upon leaving, was because Jessie, your front desk employee, was great at handling things. As far as I knew, he‚Äôd done all he could do (this was before I knew he was also lying to me about who you were). I knew that outside of that, I was not going to get any more help and decided to email the owner. Although you were there the whole time but did not convey your true identity as owner and did not speak English. What else was I to do? The manager left. You are dishonest and I‚Äôm so disgusted at how you chose to handle this whole situation.

Why respond to this review but not my email? Your response here is misleading and isn‚Äôt even close to addressing everything.

I want my money back.

Review: The kids enjoy the spot. It's nice to have the wristbands so they can't leave without you. You are able to connect to wifi and get some work done as the kids enjoy some entertainment.
